The problematic driver, 'Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. - SCSIAdapter - 9.3.0.221', was rolled out to incompatible hardware after an initial testing phase, affecting primarily owners of Gigabyte X570 motherboards. Many users were able to fix the issue through Automatic Startup Repair, while others required more complex solutions.

title: 'Mad Money' Lightning Round: Plug Power, Coinbase, Pool Corp.
summary: Jim Cramer offers his quick takes on several stocks during the "Mad Money Lightning Round." He shows bullish sentiment for Plug Power and Coinbase, recommends Pool Corp. over Leslie's, and advises against Kellogg in favor of Mondelez International.

title: Can Advanced Micro Devices stock build on momentum off huge sales growth?
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock has seen a marginal dip from recent highs, but analysts remain bullish due to significant sales growth, especially in data center products and gaming consoles. CEO Lisa Su's confident outlook on future revenue growth and a strong pipeline suggest continued positive momentum for the company, despite a recent sell-off and a creeping P/E ratio.

title: Intel vs Advanced Micro Devices (AMD)
summary: This article analyzes the long-standing rivalry between Intel and AMD, comparing their historical market dominance, recent performance, financial health, and future outlook. It highlights AMD's recent surge due to TSMC's advanced chip manufacturing, challenging Intel's traditional leadership. The author concludes by positioning AMD as a growth play and Intel as a value play, considering potential comebacks and ongoing industry challenges like chip shortages.

title: Arm details new data center chips, says Oracle, Alibaba will use them
summary: Arm Ltd revealed new details about its next-generation data center technology, with its "N2" Neoverse computing cores expected to be about 40% faster and "V1" cores 50% faster than previous methods for AI tasks. Oracle Corp and Alibaba Group Holding are set to use these new Arm-based chips, signaling a growing push into the data center processor market long dominated by Intel and AMD. This move is seen as crucial for Nvidia Corp's $40 billion acquisition of Arm, which is currently under national security review.

title: NVIDIA Announces CPU for Giant AI and High Performance Computing Workloads
summary: NVIDIA has announced its first data center CPU, Grace, an Arm-based processor designed to deliver 10x the performance of today’s fastest servers for complex AI and high-performance computing workloads. This specialized processor targets advanced applications with enormous datasets and massive memory requirements, making NVIDIA a "three-chip company" alongside its GPUs and DPUs. The Swiss National Supercomputing Centre and Los Alamos National Laboratory are among the first to plan Grace-powered supercomputers, expected online in 2023.

title: Nvidia to directly challenge Intel with Arm-based 'Grace' server chip
summary: Nvidia Corp announced its plan to develop an Arm-based server processor chip called "Grace," directly challenging Intel in the data center market. This move intensifies competition with Intel and adds complexity to the antitrust review of Nvidia's $40 billion acquisition of Arm. The new server chip, expected in 2023, is designed for artificial intelligence algorithms, further solidifying Nvidia's focus on AI computing.

title: Nvidia steps up competition with Intel and AMD with first data-center CPU, based on Arm
summary: Nvidia introduced its first data-center CPU, named Grace, which is based on Arm technology, intensifying its competition with Intel and AMD in the artificial intelligence and data-center market. This move comes as Nvidia awaits approval for its $40 billion acquisition of Arm Holdings PLC, showcasing its strategy to leverage licensed technology for future AI business. The new CPU, announced at Nvidia's annual GTC developers conference, aims to challenge the dominance of Intel and AMD in the server CPU space.

title: Nvidia steps up competition with Intel and AMD with first data-center CPU, based on Arm
summary: Nvidia introduced its first data-center CPU, named Grace, which is based on Arm technology, intensifying its competition with Intel and AMD in the artificial-intelligence market. This move comes as Nvidia awaits approval for its $40 billion acquisition of Arm Holdings PLC, demonstrating its strategy for future AI business. The new CPU bundle for servers enters a market traditionally dominated by Intel and AMD.

title: Nvidia steps up competition with Intel and AMD with first data-center CPU, based on Arm
summary: Nvidia introduced its first data-center CPU, named Grace, based on Arm technology, aiming to intensify its competition with Intel and AMD in the artificial-intelligence market. This move signals Nvidia's commitment to the chip-making sector, leveraging technology from its acquisition target, Arm Holdings PLC, to tap into the growing AI business. The announcement was made during Nvidia’s annual GTC developers conference by CEO Jensen Huang.

title: AMD Secretly Drops Radeon RX 6800 XT "Midnight Black" Edition GPU
summary: AMD released a limited edition Radeon RX 6800 XT "Midnight Black" Edition GPU, exclusively announced to its "AMD Red Team Community." Despite efforts, the graphics card, which shares performance specs with the regular version but features a special black shroud, sold out within minutes due to bots and scalpers, making it difficult for fans to acquire. The $649 USD card is now fetching upwards of $1,700 USD on eBay, highlighting ongoing GPU shortage issues and frustrations among gamers.

title: The Alienware m15 Ryzen Edition R5 is an AMD-NVIDIA combo over a decade in the making
summary: The Alienware m15 Ryzen Edition R5 is announced, marking the first Alienware notebook in over a decade to combine AMD processors with NVIDIA graphics. This gaming laptop features Ryzen 5000 series CPUs and NVIDIA RTX 30-series GPUs, along with other advancements like 3200Mhz DDR4 memory and a CHERRY-based mechanical keyboard. It will be available starting April 7th in China, April 20th in the US, and May 4th globally, with select configurations beginning at $1793.98.

title: Intel Launches Its Most Advanced Performance Data Center Platform
summary: Intel has launched its 3rd Gen Intel Xeon Scalable processors (code-named “Ice Lake”), marking its most advanced performance data center platform. These processors offer an average 46% increase in performance for popular data center workloads, alongside built-in AI acceleration and advanced security features. The platform is optimized for a broad range of applications across cloud, network, and intelligent edge environments, with significant industry adoption already underway.

title: AMD, Salesforce, HP, Xilinx and Sanmina paid $0 in federal income taxes in 2020 despite $4.1B in combined profits
summary: Five Bay Area tech firms, including AMD and Salesforce, reportedly paid no federal income taxes in 2020 despite combined profits of $4.1 billion. The companies legally achieved this by utilizing various credits and maneuvers. AMD, led by CEO Lisa Su, has not paid federal income taxes for the last three years, despite earning $1.7 billion during that period.

title: Salesforce paid no federal income tax in 2020 despite $2.6 billion in profit
summary: Salesforce, despite recording $2.6 billion in net income in its 2021 fiscal year, paid no federal income tax in 2020 and is receiving a $12 million refund. This was revealed in a report by the Institute for Tax and Economic Policy, noting that the company utilized benefits such as writing off executive stock-option-related expenses. Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff had previously supported San Francisco's Proposition C, which increased the company's city taxes, while the company took no position on federal tax cuts.

title: The China challenge: Why Intel is too strategic to fail
summary: This article analyzes Intel's strategic shift to IDM 2.0 under CEO Pat Gelsinger, focusing on the company's plan to leverage internal manufacturing, external foundries, and a new Intel Foundry Services division. It examines the market changes impacting Intel, the critical threat from China's semiconductor ambitions, and the need for significant partnerships, including with IBM and the U.S. government, for Intel to regain its leadership and combat the China challenge. The authors argue that despite positive steps, Intel needs even more substantial changes, possibly a joint venture with a volume leader like Samsung, to succeed.

title: NZXT launches its first AMD motherboard with the new N7 B550
summary: NZXT has launched its first AMD motherboard, the N7 B550, expanding its product catalog to include AMD platforms. This premium motherboard features a 12+2 power phase design, Wi-Fi 6, support for up to 4733MHz RAM, and PCIe 4.0, retailing for $229.99. The N7 B550 is compatible with Ryzen 3000, 4000, and 5000 series processors and incorporates NZXT's signature sleek design with a customizable metal shroud.

title: In $20bn push, Intel hopes to make US chip-making great again
summary: Intel announced a significant expansion of its advanced chip manufacturing capacity with a $20bn investment to build two factories in Arizona, aiming to regain its market leadership and challenge rivals TSMC and Samsung. CEO Pat Gelsinger's strategy includes opening Intel's plants to outside customers in a "foundry" business model and focusing on cutting-edge computing chip manufacturing. This move is also a response to US and European concerns about the concentration of chipmaking in Asia and seeks to boost domestic production.

title: Laptop Bench Test: Dell Latitude 5410 – An upgrade in mediocrity?
summary: This article reviews the Dell Latitude 5410 laptop, evaluating if it offers significant upgrades over its predecessor or remains a mediocre device. The review details specifications, performance benchmarks (Cinebench, GeekBench), and its suitability for corporate use, concluding it's a solid "fleet laptop" for business tasks rather than a high-performance personal device.

title: Boston Limited Now Offering AMD EPYC™ 7003 Series Processor Powered Systems
summary: Boston Limited has announced the availability of high-performance systems featuring the new AMD EPYC™ 7003 Series Processors. These processors, based on the "Zen 3" microarchitecture, offer significant performance improvements and are designed to speed up data analytics and deliver faster time to value for businesses. Boston's solutions, including the Quattro Series, aim to meet the demands of industries like media and entertainment, manufacturing, design, and engineering, by providing high processing performance within customers' power budgets.

title: Applied Materials brings AI and big data into semiconductor inspection machines
summary: Applied Materials has introduced new optical semiconductor wafer inspection machines that integrate big data and AI to enhance defect detection and accelerate chip manufacturing. These systems, including Enlight and ExtractAI technology, aim to address the increasing complexity and cost of chip production by improving inspection efficiency and reducing yield loss. The AI-driven approach helps chipmakers identify critical defects faster and adapt to changing manufacturing processes, ultimately boosting profitability.

title: Qualcomm Completes Acquisition of NUVIA
summary: Qualcomm Incorporated announced the completion of its acquisition of NUVIA for $1.4 billion. This acquisition aims to enhance Qualcomm's CPU roadmap, integrating next-generation CPUs across various products including smartphones, laptops, and automotive systems. The first Qualcomm Snapdragon platforms featuring these new internally designed CPUs are expected to sample in the second half of 2022.

title: Energy efficient and scalable: NXP’s new EdgeVerse chips are aimed at industrial edge uses
summary: NXP Semiconductors expanded its EdgeVerse portfolio with new i.MX 8ULP, i.MX 8ULP-CS (cloud secured) with Microsoft Azure Sphere, and i.MX 9 series processors. These new chips feature the EdgeLock secure enclave for enhanced security and Energy Flex architecture for maximized energy efficiency, targeting industrial edge applications. The i.MX 9 series also integrates hardware neural processing units for accelerating machine learning at the edge.

title: AMD and Xilinx Set to Merge Before the End of 2021, Looks Promising
summary: Rival chipmakers Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) and Xilinx are proceeding with a $35 billion all-stock merger, expected to finalize by the end of 2021. The deal will see AMD shareholders owning 74% of the new entity and Xilinx shareholders 26%, with Xilinx stockholders receiving 1.734 shares of AMD for each of their shares. This merger aims to diversify AMD's product portfolio and strengthen its position in computer processors, particularly in data centers and wireless networks.

title: Changing Of The Guard For HPC And Big Iron At HPE
summary: Pete Ungaro, the long-time head of Cray and then HPE's High Performance Computing & Mission Critical Solutions group, is stepping down, with Justin Hotard taking over. This leadership change occurs as HPE continues to navigate a challenging market, focusing on profitability and leveraging the Cray acquisition to scale its HPC business. The company is making strategic bets on services and utility-style pricing for on-premises systems, with recent financial results indicating these efforts are beginning to pay off despite overall revenue and profit declines in some segments.

title: Barstool's Portnoy backs new BUZZ ETF
summary: Barstool Sports founder Dave Portnoy announced his backing of the new BUZZ ETF, which is set to debut on the NYSE. This ETF leverages artificial intelligence to analyze social media chatter and track the top 75 large-cap stocks with market capitalizations over $5 billion. Portnoy, who holds an ownership stake in BUZZ, highlighted that the algorithm outperformed the S&P 500 by 40% in 2020.

title: You can now buy AMD's Ryzen Threadripper Pro CPUs on their own
summary: AMD has made its Ryzen Threadripper Pro CPUs available for individual purchase. Previously, these powerful processors, designed for demanding professional workloads in workstations, were only available pre-installed in systems like the Lenovo ThinkStation P620. While offering up to 64 cores and extensive PCIe 4.0 lanes, these high-end CPUs come with premium price tags, starting from $1,149 up to $5,489.

title: AMD Radeon RX 6700 XT GPU appears in leaked images
summary: Images of what appear to be the ASUS Radeon RX 6700 XT GPU, specifically the DUAL and TUF models, have leaked online ahead of its anticipated announcement on March 3, 2021. The RX 6700 XT is expected to be an RDNA 2-based successor to the RX 5700 XT, featuring a Navi 22 GPU with 40 CUs, 2,560 Stream Processors, and 12GB of GDDR6 RAM. Leaked details include specific design elements like slot width, length, and power connectors for both the dual-fan and triple-fan (TUF Gaming OC) variants.

title: Does AMD Smart Access Memory work with Ryzen 3000 processors?
summary: AMD Smart Access Memory (SAM) is a feature exclusive to AMD Ryzen 5000 series CPUs when paired with Radeon RX 6000 series GPUs and AMD 500 series chipsets. It does not work with older Ryzen 3000 processors. SAM leverages a fully open data channel between the CPU and GPU, offering a performance boost in games, although the extent of this boost can vary.

title: Semiconductor Chemical Vapor Deposition (CVD) Equipment
summary: The report provides a strategic analysis of the Global Semiconductor Chemical Vapor Deposition (CVD) Equipment Market and the growth estimates for the forecast period 2021 to 2026. This market is anticipated to witness a CAGR of 8.5% over the forecast period, driven by an increase in demand for microelectronics and consumer electronics. Key players include AIXTRON SE, Applied Materials, Inc., ASM International, and CVD Equipment Corporation.

title: New SparX-5i family of Ethernet switches from Microchip
summary: Microchip Technology Inc. has announced its SparX-5i family of Ethernet switches, a single-chip, IEEE standards-based solution offering the industry’s most complete Time Sensitive Networking (TSN) feature set. These switches aim to simplify the pathway to TSN compatible infrastructure for industrial automation networks by enabling increased connectivity and network optimization while lowering costs. The SparX-5i family supports various key TSN IEEE standards for real-time communication and offers flexible connectivity with multiple GbE interfaces.

title: Microchip Announces the World’s First PCI Express® 5.0 Switches
summary: Microchip Technology Inc. announced the world's first PCI Express (PCIe) 5.0 switch solutions, the Switchtec PFX PCIe 5.0 family, to meet the increasing demand for high-performance computing in applications like data analytics and autonomous driving. These switches double interconnect performance and, combined with XpressConnect retimers, make Microchip the sole provider of both PCIe Gen 5 switches and retimer products, offering a complete infrastructure solution. The Switchtec PFX family supports high-density, high-reliability applications and includes advanced debug and diagnostic features to accelerate time-to-market.

title: Supermicro Unveils NVIDIA GPU Server Test Drive Program with Leading Channel Partners to Deliver Workload Qualification on Remote Supermicro Servers
summary: Supermicro has launched a new GPU test-drive program called STEP, in collaboration with NVIDIA and leading channel partners. This program allows customers to remotely test Supermicro's 2U HGX A100 4-GPU or 4U HGX A100 8-GPU systems, enabling them to qualify their advanced workloads on high-performance platforms. The initiative aims to accelerate time-to-market solutions for AI and HPC applications by providing access to cutting-edge NVIDIA HGX A100 technology.

title: Intel CEO Bob Swan to Be Replaced by VMware Chief
summary: Intel Corp. Chief Executive Officer Bob Swan will be replaced by VMware Inc. CEO Pat Gelsinger, who is returning to Intel more than a decade after leaving. This leadership change comes as Intel faces manufacturing delays, increased competition, and customers designing their own chips. Gelsinger's appointment is seen as a move to bring back technical and home-grown leadership to address the company's challenges.

title: Top Analyst Upgrades and Downgrades: AMD, Adobe, Chevron, Chipotle, DuPont, Intel, Penn National Gaming and More
summary: This article details top analyst upgrades, downgrades, and initiations announced on January 14, 2021, for various major companies. It provides specific ratings, target prices, and consensus figures for stocks like AMD, Adobe, Chevron, Chipotle, DuPont, and Intel. The report also notes the market context of the announcements, including impending Q4 earnings reports and Intel's CEO change.

title: Supermicro Unveils Threadripper PRO Powered Workstation with Double-Width GPU Support
summary: Supermicro has unveiled a new server-grade, high-end workstation (AS-5014A-TT) powered by the AMD Ryzen Threadripper PRO Processor, supporting up to 64 cores and 128 PCI-E 4.0 lanes. This workstation is designed for demanding professional workloads such as media content creation, scientific research, and AI, offering support for up to four double-width GPUs and 2 TB of DDR4 3200 memory. Supermicro emphasizes its advanced design and architecture, aiming to significantly boost productivity for professionals.

title: 25 of the Best Stocks to Own in January
summary: This article identifies Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc (NASDAQ:HII) as a top stock for January, highlighting its historical performance of averaging a 5.7% gain in January over the past decade with 100% positive returns. It suggests that now is an opportune time to consider buying options on HII due to relatively low volatility expectations and potential for a rally as investor pessimism might unwind. The stock's current price is $170.47.

title: Rock star chip designer Jim Keller joins Tenstorrent
summary: Legendary computer chip designer Jim Keller has joined Toronto startup Tenstorrent Inc. as its new president and chief technology officer. Keller, known for his work at AMD, Apple, and Tesla, will guide Tenstorrent in its mission to create a machine learning training chip that utilizes software to optimize computing power and increase efficiency, challenging established players like Intel, AMD, and Nvidia.

title: Exclusive: Hedge fund Third Point urges Intel to explore deal options
summary: Activist hedge fund Third Point LLC, which has amassed a nearly $1 billion stake in Intel Corp, is urging the U.S. chipmaker to explore strategic alternatives, including whether it should keep chip design and production under one roof. Third Point CEO Daniel Loeb sent a letter to Intel Chairman Omar Ishrak, calling for immediate action to boost the company's position, address "human capital management issue," and consider divesting failed acquisitions. This push comes as Intel has lost market share to competitors like TSMC, Samsung, and AMD, and its stock has underperformed the Nasdaq Composite Index.

title: Speaker Spotlight: "staying on top of trends involves being a gamer yourself" says Roundhill Investments' Mario Stefanidis
summary: Mario Stefanidis of Roundhill Investments discusses the intersection of finance and the games industry, emphasizing the importance of being an active gamer to understand evolving trends. He highlights how the COVID-19 pandemic accelerated growth in gaming and predicts future trends like cloud gaming expansion and new VR titles. Stefanidis also shares insights into Roundhill Investments' focus on thematic investing in digital media and entertainment.

title: Intel shares rise after Third Point urges chipmaker to explore strategic alternatives as market share deteriorates
summary: Hedge fund Third Point, which recently acquired a significant stake in Intel, is urging the chipmaker's board to explore strategic alternatives due to deteriorating market share against rivals like TSMC, Samsung, and AMD. Third Point highlighted concerns about Intel's loss of manufacturing leadership and its impact on U.S. national security. Intel has stated it welcomes input from investors to enhance shareholder value.

title: R. Scott Hills Celebrated for Dedication to the Field of Electronics
summary: R. Scott Hills has been recognized by Marquis Who's Who for his impactful career in the electronics field, spanning several decades and executive roles at prominent companies like AMD, VLSI Technologies, and Cirrus Logic Inc. He is currently the Worldwide Vice President of Sales and Marketing for Seamless Microsystems Incorporated and aims to become a board member at an electronics company, mentoring the next generation. Hills is particularly proud of his role in the transition from mainframe computers to innovative mini-computers and highly integrated semiconductor solutions.

title: Billionaire's Company Moves to Texas — But He'll Work from His Private $300M Hawaii Island Instead
summary: Oracle, co-founded by Larry Ellison, announced its corporate headquarters are moving from California to Austin, Texas. However, Ellison himself will not be relocating to Texas, revealing he has moved to his private $300 million Hawaiian island of Lanai and will work remotely from there. This move is part of a larger trend of tech companies relocating to Texas, drawn by its business climate and lower taxes.

title: What margins, financials say about Nvidia’s growth prospects
summary: This article examines Nvidia's growth prospects through its operating performance, margins, and investment in R&D. It highlights the strong role of PC gaming and accelerated computing in margin expansion, despite partial offsets from Tegra processors. The article also notes Nvidia's higher R&D investment compared to competitors like AMD and Intel, suggesting a commitment to innovation for future growth.

title: Intel's 3D XPoint dominance will face challenge from Micron
summary: Intel's initial dominance in the 3D XPoint market with its Optane products is expected to face significant competition, primarily from Micron Technology, starting around 2022. The article discusses the potential for other vendors like Samsung and SK Hynix to enter the market and highlights the role of new technologies like Computer Express Link (CXL) in accelerating 3D XPoint adoption across different processor architectures. Market analysts predict substantial growth in 3D XPoint revenue, with DIMMs becoming a major revenue driver, and Micron is preparing to release competitive products, including DIMMs, leveraging these new interface standards.

title: What Salesforce’s $27.7 Billion Acquisition of Slack Means for the Workplace
summary: Salesforce announced its acquisition of Slack for $27.7 billion, making it Salesforce's largest purchase and one of the biggest acquisitions of 2020. Slack will become the interface for Salesforce’s software, integrating with Salesforce Customer 360 and opening Salesforce to a wider business audience. This deal also intensifies competition with Microsoft, which offers Microsoft Teams.

title: Qualcomm taps Samsung to make new flagship 5G smartphone chips
summary: Qualcomm announced its new flagship 5G smartphone chip, the Snapdragon 888, which will be manufactured by Samsung Electronics. This chip features enhanced gaming and photo abilities and is expected to be in high-end Android phones from brands like Xiaomi and LG in Q1 next year. Samsung secured the manufacturing contract on its 5-nanometer process, a first for Qualcomm's flagship chip.

title: NVIDIA Unlikely to Compete with AMD on 7-nm Node
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is developing ray tracing technology for its future GPUs, with plans to launch 7-nm gaming GPUs ahead of NVIDIA. NVIDIA, however, is not rushing to adopt 7-nm technology, focusing instead on affordable and power-efficient 12-nm FinFET processes for its current Turing GPUs. The article suggests NVIDIA might skip 7-nm and directly move to 7-nm+ or 5-nm nodes in the future.

title: Should Investors Worry about AMD’s Negative Cash Flow?
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) reported negative cash flow in the first quarter due to increased inventory, low-profit margins, and receivable timing. This led to a free cash flow of -$275 million. Despite these short-term challenges, the company expects strong cash flows in the second half of the year and positive free cash flow for the full year, supported by a significantly improved balance sheet.

title: AMD’s Ryzen 3000 Series Beats Intel CPUs in Price and Performance
summary: AMD's new Ryzen 3000 series CPUs, including the Ryzen 9 3900X and Ryzen 7 3700X, are challenging Intel's dominance by offering superior performance and competitive pricing. The Ryzen 9 3900X competes directly with Intel's Core i9 9920X, while the Ryzen 7 3700X provides better multi-threaded performance and power efficiency than Intel's Core i7-9700K at a lower cost.

title: Why Some Exposure to VanEck’s Gaming ETF Is Prudent
summary: The article discusses the growth and mainstream adoption of the esports industry, highlighting its global phenomenon status and substantial investment from various sectors beyond just tech. It suggests that the VanEck Vectors Video Gaming and eSports ETF (ESPO) is a prudent investment for those seeking exposure to the gaming and related industries, including major players like Tencent and Activision Blizzard, as well as chipmakers like NVIDIA and AMD. The ETF is presented as a way to capitalize on the continued surge in the gaming and esports market.

title: Nvidia, Epic to bring 'Fortnite' back to iPhones in 'near future'
summary: Nvidia and Epic Games are collaborating to bring "Fortnite" back to Apple iPhones through Nvidia's GeForce NOW streaming game service in the near future. The game was removed from Apple's App Store in August due to Epic's billing system, which violated Apple's rules. This return route bypasses Apple's App Store rules by utilizing the iPhone's Safari web browser.

title: Qorvo CEO Bob Bruggeworth Elected Chair of Semiconductor Industry Association
summary: Robert (Bob) Bruggeworth, President, CEO, and Director of Qorvo, has been elected as the 2021 Chair of the Semiconductor Industry Association (SIA), with Steve Mollenkopf, CEO and Director of Qualcomm, named Vice Chair. Both leaders bring extensive engineering and leadership experience to SIA during what is anticipated to be a pivotal year for the industry. They will work to advance semiconductor industry priorities globally and advocate for policies supporting U.S. leadership in semiconductor technology.

title: Earnings: Nvidia Corp. (NASDAQ: NVDA) reports Q3 2021 financial results
summary: Nvidia reported a sharp increase in third-quarter earnings for 2021, surpassing market projections. Adjusted profit climbed to $2.91 per share, and revenue rose 57% annually to $4.73 billion, both exceeding Street views. Despite strong results, the company's stock dropped during after-hours trading following the announcement.

title: AMD reveals ‘world’s fastest’ supercomputer graphics card
summary: AMD has unveiled the MI100, a new graphics processing unit designed for supercomputers, which it claims is the fastest chip in its class with over 10 teraflops of peak performance. This chip is designed to meet the growing demand for GPUs in scientific computing, particularly for machine learning workloads. The MI100 features Matrix Core Technology for AI acceleration and Infinity Fabric for connecting multiple GPUs, positioning AMD to compete strongly in the expanding supercomputing market against rivals like Nvidia.

title: GlobalFoundries Awarded $400M Ceiling Increase Under DoD Microelectronics Contract
summary: GlobalFoundries has been awarded a $400 million ceiling increase under a Department of Defense microelectronics contract, raising its cumulative value to $1.11 billion. This modification ensures GlobalFoundries continues to provide microelectronic products and trusted processes to the DoD, driven by increased demand for both leading-edge and end-of-life technologies. The work is expected to be completed by March 31, 2021.

title: How to check if you have latest motherboard BIOS for AMD Ryzen 5000 CPUs
summary: This article provides a guide on how to check and update the motherboard BIOS to support AMD Ryzen 5000 series CPUs. It includes comprehensive lists of compatible X570, B550, and A520 motherboards from various manufacturers like ASRock, ASUS, GIGABYTE, and MSI, along with their minimum required BIOS versions. The guide details both automatic and manual BIOS update methods and recommends specific AMD Ryzen 5900X CPU and ASUS TUF Gaming B550M-Plus motherboard.

title: Apple's new Macs could revive the PC chip wars, analysts say
summary: Apple's expected unveiling of new Mac computers with in-house processor chips based on Arm Ltd. technology could re-ignite competition in the PC chip market, currently dominated by Intel and Advanced Micro Devices. This shift marks a departure from Apple's nearly 15-year relationship with Intel and could benefit companies like Qualcomm, which has been adapting Arm-based processors for Windows PCs. Analysts believe Apple's entry will accelerate the adoption of Arm-based PCs, although challenges remain for software compatibility.

title: Marvell to buy Inphi in $10bn semiconductor deal
summary: Semiconductor company Marvell Technology Group is set to acquire Inphi Corp in a $10 billion cash-and-stock deal. The acquisition aims to strengthen Marvell's leadership in cloud infrastructure and expand its 5G presence, leveraging Inphi's expertise in fiber-optic data traffic and its customer base including Amazon, Google, Microsoft, and Facebook. This move is part of a broader trend of consolidation within the semiconductor industry.

title: AMD’s Lisa Su challenges Intel with record Xilinx deal
summary: AMD CEO Lisa Su has announced a US$35 billion all-stock acquisition of Xilinx Inc, marking one of the largest chip deals ever and a direct challenge to Intel's dominance. This strategic move aims to expand AMD into new markets like automotive and communications networking, bolstering its offerings in cloud data centers. The acquisition will significantly increase AMD's research and development budget, positioning the company for future technical leadership, building on Su's successful turnaround of AMD since 2014.

title: AMD Unveils Next-Generation PC Gaming with AMD Radeon™ RX 6000 Series – Bringing Leadership 4K Resolution Performance to AAA Gaming
summary: AMD announced its Radeon RX 6000 Series graphics cards, including the RX 6800, RX 6800 XT, and the flagship RX 6900 XT. These cards are built on the RDNA 2 gaming architecture, offering significant performance improvements and new features for 4K and 1440p gaming. Key innovations include AMD Infinity Cache, Smart Access Memory, and support for DirectX 12 Ultimate's raytracing capabilities.

title: AMD Agrees to Buy Rival Chip Maker Xilinx for $35 Billion - WSJ
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) plans to acquire Xilinx Inc. for $35 billion in an all-stock deal, intensifying consolidation in the semiconductor industry. This acquisition is expected to significantly broaden AMD's product offerings and market reach, providing an immediate financial boost upon closure. The Wall Street Journal had previously reported on the impending agreement between the two rival chip makers.

title: AMD Agrees to Buy Xilinx for $35 Billion in Stock (Published 2020)
summary: Advanced Micro Devices has agreed to acquire Xilinx for $35 billion in an all-stock deal, aiming to expand its chip business into new markets like 5G communications and automotive electronics. This acquisition is part of a broader trend of consolidation in the chip industry and would position AMD to compete more fiercely with rivals like Nvidia and Intel. The deal is expected to help AMD grow its presence in data centers and enhance its profitability.

title: AMD to buy chip peer Xilinx for $35 billion in data center push
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) announced an all-stock deal to acquire Xilinx for $35 billion, intensifying its competition with Intel in the data center chip market. The acquisition is expected to close by the end of 2021 and aims to leverage the strengths of both companies in the growing data center and AI sectors, benefiting from their shared reliance on TSMC for manufacturing.

title: AMD Agrees to Buy Chipmaker Xilinx (XLNX) in $35 Billion All-Stock Deal
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) has agreed to acquire Xilinx Inc. for $35 billion in an all-stock deal, marking AMD's largest acquisition to date. This move is expected to bolster AMD's product offerings and intensify its competition with Intel Corp. Xilinx investors will receive 1.7234 AMD shares for each Xilinx stock, valuing Xilinx at approximately $143 per share, a 25% premium over its closing price before the announcement.

title: AMD to buy Xilinx in $35B tech mega-deal
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) has agreed to acquire Xilinx Inc. in a $35 billion all-stock deal, aiming to strengthen its position in the data center chip market and become a more formidable competitor to Intel. The acquisition is expected to bolster AMD's margins, earnings per share, and free cash flow, with synergies projected to yield $300 million in efficiencies within 18 months of closing. Xilinx shareholders will receive 1.7234 AMD shares for each Xilinx share, representing a 25% premium, with AMD shareholders owning approximately 74% of the combined company.

title: STMicroelectronics Unveils Features of Multi-Application, Deterministic Automotive Microcontrollers to Maximize Safety and Security in Next-Generation Domain/Zone Architectures
summary: STMicroelectronics has revealed features of its Stellar automotive microcontrollers, co-developed with Bosch, designed to ensure reliable and deterministic execution of multiple independent real-time applications in next-generation automotive architectures. These MCUs offer virtualization capabilities, hardware support for virtualization, quality of service settings, and resource separation to allow independent applications to coexist securely while meeting stringent safety standards. A key feature is the non-volatile Phase-Change Memory (PCM), enabling fast read access and zero-downtime over-the-air updates, even for full memory refreshes.

title: TSMC Announces 2020 OIP Partner of the Year Awards for Excellence in Accelerating Silicon Innovation
summary: TSMC recognized 10 EDA, IP, and Cloud Alliance partners with its 2020 OIP Partner of the Year awards for their outstanding contributions to accelerating silicon innovation and reducing time to market for IC designers. These partners demonstrated excellence in next-generation system-on-chip (SoC) and 3DIC design enablement, helping customers overcome design barriers and achieve first-time silicon success. The awards highlight the crucial role of ecosystem partners in supporting TSMC's latest technologies and advanced foundry solutions.

title: Opinion: How did Intel lose its Silicon Valley crown?
summary: This article discusses Intel's decline as the leading chip manufacturer in Silicon Valley, examining whether the challenges stem from technological limits or leadership decisions. The chip giant announced a delay in its 7-nanometer manufacturing process and considered outsourcing some production for a key next-generation chip, shocking investors and analysts. This move is seen as a significant setback for the company once considered the standard-bearer of Moore's Law.

title: Hesai: PandarXT ─ The Next Generation of LiDAR
summary: Hesai Technology has released PandarXT, a new 32-channel mid-range LiDAR sensor, featuring a novel system architecture with Hesai’s self-developed LiDAR ASICs. This cost-effective solution is designed for various applications including autonomous logistics, robotics, and mapping, aiming to balance performance, reliability, and cost. The PandarXT represents a breakthrough in LiDAR design, offering high performance and manufacturing scalability for LiDAR-powered applications.

title: Infographic: United Airlines Holdings (UAL) reports Q3 financial results
summary: United Airlines Holdings (UAL) reported a wider-than-expected loss in the third quarter of 2020 due to continued COVID-19 related disruptions, missing Wall Street projections. The adjusted loss was $8.16 per share, a significant decline from the previous year's earnings. Operating revenues fell by 78% to $2.49 billion, causing the stock to drop in after-hours trading.

title: Loop Industries (LOOP) stock: Tapping into infinite plastic recycling
summary: Loop Industries aims to overcome the limitations of mechanical recycling through its patented chemical recycling technology, which allows for unlimited plastic recycling and substitutes virgin plastics. The company, which is pre-revenue, has already secured packaging deals with major consumer brands like PepsiCo and Coca-Cola, aligning with global sustainability targets. Loop Industries plans to expand its operations globally through partnerships and eventually license its technology as a key growth driver.

title: WSJ News Exclusive | AMD Is in Advanced Talks to Buy Xilinx
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) is reportedly in advanced talks to acquire rival chip maker Xilinx Inc. The potential deal could be valued at over $30 billion, marking a significant consolidation in the semiconductor industry. This acquisition would enhance AMD's competitive position against Intel and expand its presence in telecommunications and defense markets.

title: AMD launches new Ryzen 5000 series CPUs, based on Zen 3 architecture
summary: AMD has officially launched its new Ryzen 5000 series desktop processors, built on the Zen 3 architecture, promising significant generational leaps in performance and power efficiency. These new CPUs, including the Ryzen 9 5900X and 5950X, are set to offer substantial improvements in single-threaded and gaming performance compared to their predecessors. The Ryzen 5000 series goes on sale November 5, with prices ranging from $300 to $800.

title: Top 10 Memory ICs Manufacture Companies in the World
summary: This article lists the top 10 memory ICs manufacturing companies globally, highlighting their contributions to the electronics industry. It details how memory ICs are crucial for digital data storage in various electronic devices and introduces key players known for their innovative solutions and comprehensive product portfolios in this sector.

title: Taiwan-born AMD boss Lisa Su to receive top prize
summary: Lisa Su, the Taiwan-born president and CEO of AMD, is set to receive the prestigious Robert N. Noyce Award from the Semiconductor Industry Association for her contributions to the semiconductor industry. Su, who emigrated to the US at age 3, is recognized for advancing leading-edge semiconductor and high-performance computing technologies and inspiring others in tech. She is the second ethnic Chinese awardee for this honor.

title: -Nvidia to buy chip designer Arm for $40 bln as SoftBank exits
summary: Nvidia announced its acquisition of UK-based chip designer Arm from SoftBank Group for $40 billion, a deal set to significantly impact the global semiconductor sector. The acquisition poses questions regarding Arm's maintained neutrality under U.S. ownership and faces regulatory scrutiny, particularly in China. Nvidia plans to expand Arm's licensing model and integrate its own IP, while SoftBank exits Arm to raise cash.

title: Nvidia jumps on $40 billion chip deal; analysts expect tough scrutiny
summary: Nvidia's shares surged after announcing a $40 billion deal to acquire UK-based chip designer Arm from SoftBank, marking a potential shift in the chip industry landscape. Analysts anticipate significant regulatory challenges for the acquisition, particularly from China, due to its scale and implications for competition. The deal is seen as a major move for Nvidia, positioning it among top chip suppliers, but also raising concerns among rivals and regulators.

title: Nvidia reaches $40B deal to buy SoftBank's Arm Holdings
summary: Nvidia has agreed to acquire Arm Holdings from SoftBank Group and SoftBank Vision Fund for $40 billion in stock and cash. This deal, which includes $21.5 billion in Nvidia stock and $12 billion cash, aims to position Nvidia strongly in the age of AI, leveraging Arm's processor designs to compete in the data center chip market. SoftBank will retain a less than 10% stake in Arm after the acquisition.

title: Duration: 3 minutes, 1 second.
summary: UK tech giant Arm Holdings is being sold to US company Nvidia for $40bn (£31bn) in a deal that faces regulatory approval and opposition from rivals and politicians. Arm co-founder Hermann Hauser heavily criticized the takeover, calling it an "absolute disaster" that would lead to job losses and destroy the company's business model. Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has pledged to keep Arm headquartered in Cambridge and invest in a new AI research facility there, but the deal raises concerns about Arm's neutrality and its position in the US-China tech rivalry.

title: What Intel Is Planning for The Future of Quantum Computing: Hot Qubits, Cold Control Chips, and Rapid Testing
summary: Jim Clarke, Intel's director of quantum hardware, outlines the company's strategy for achieving "quantum practicality" through silicon-based quantum computers. Key focuses include developing "hot" silicon spin qubits, cold control chips like Horse Ridge, and rapid testing methods using cryoprobers to overcome scaling and wiring challenges. The company aims to make quantum computing useful by addressing issues like coherence time, error correction, and efficient interconnects.

title: Dell EMC PowerEdge C6525 Review 2U4N AMD EPYC Kilo-thread Server
summary: The Dell EMC PowerEdge C6525 is a 2U 4-node server designed for high-density computing, utilizing AMD EPYC 7002 "Rome" processors to provide up to 512 cores and 1024 threads per chassis. The review examines the chassis design, node features, and performance aspects, highlighting its benefits in compute density and thermal management. It also touches upon the controversial CPU locking mechanisms implemented by Dell.

title: Intel plans big stock buyback after shares plummet, boosting prices in after-hours trading
summary: Intel announced a plan to buy back $10 billion of its stock by the end of the year, following a nearly 19% drop in its shares over the past month. This decision resulted in a nearly 4% gain in after-hours trading. The company views these repurchases as prudent given that its shares are trading below intrinsic valuation, amidst struggles with new chip engineering and increased competition from rivals like AMD and Nvidia.

title: IBM rolls out newest processor chip, taps Samsung for manufacturing
summary: IBM has announced its new Power10 processor chip for data centers, designed to handle three times the workload of its predecessor and perform AI tasks up to 20 times faster. Samsung Electronics Co Ltd will manufacture the chip using its 7-nanometer process. This move allows IBM to compete against Intel, especially given Intel's manufacturing delays.

title: IBM rolls out newest processor chip
summary: International Business Machines Corp (IBM) announced a new Power10 processor chip designed for data centers, capable of handling three times the workload of its predecessor and up to 20 times faster for artificial intelligence computing tasks. The chip, manufactured by Samsung Electronics Co Ltd (005930.KS) using 7-nanometer technology, positions IBM to compete more effectively with Intel Corp, especially given Intel's noted manufacturing delays. This move highlights IBM's continued focus on high-performance computing systems.

title: Nvidia hurdles $300 billion market cap, which Intel hasn’t topped since the dot-com bust
summary: Nvidia Corp. has achieved a market capitalization exceeding $300 billion for the first time, establishing itself as the largest U.S. chip company. This milestone comes as Nvidia's stock has surged over 100% this year, contrasting sharply with Intel's recent struggles. Nvidia is poised to report its second-quarter earnings soon, with strong market performance leading into the announcement.

title: Swing Trading Semiconductors The IBD Way
summary: This article details Investor's Business Daily's (IBD) swing trading strategy for semiconductor stocks, emphasizing a shift from a semiconductor ETF to individual sector leaders like AMD and Nvidia. It highlights how the strategy adapted to the coronavirus market rally, initially gaining broad exposure through an ETF and later refining positions to focus on outperforming individual stocks. The piece explains IBD's method of identifying and investing in strong leaders for optimal swing trading results.

title: IBM rolls out Power10 chip for data centres; taps Samsung for manufacturing
summary: IBM has announced its new Power10 processor chip for data centers, designed to handle three times the workload of its predecessor. The Power10 chip will be manufactured by Samsung Electronics Co Ltd using its 7-nanometer chip manufacturing process. This move strengthens IBM's focus on high-performance computing systems.

title: Beelink GT-R Review – An AMD Ryzen 5 Mini PC Tested with Windows 10 and Ubuntu 20.04
summary: This article reviews the Beelink GT-R mini PC, an AMD Ryzen 5-based device tested with both Windows 10 and Ubuntu 20.04. It covers hardware specifications, performance benchmarks across both operating systems, gaming capabilities, thermal management, power consumption, and BIOS settings. The review highlights its strong performance compared to lower-powered Intel mini PCs, the quality of its port selection, and discusses the noise level of its fans under load.

title: Lisa Su’s AMD Is Flying High as Rival Chip Maker Intel Stumbles
summary: Lisa Su's AMD is experiencing a surge in demand and market share, outperforming rival Intel Corp. The company's chips are in high demand due to remote work, personal computers, and gaming consoles, leading to a raised full-year sales outlook. This success is attributed to strategic decisions made by CEO Lisa Su over the past six years.

title: Consider this ETF as AMD Closes in on $100 Billion Market Cap
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is nearing a $100 billion market capitalization, driven by strong earnings and market share gains from Intel. This article suggests the VanEck Vectors Semiconductor ETF (SMH) as a way to invest in semiconductors, highlighting its focus on highly liquid and leading companies in the industry. It also presents iShares PHLX Semiconductor ETF (SOXX) and SPDR S&P Semiconductor ETF (XSD) as alternative investment options.

title: AMD closes just shy of $100-billion market cap, as more analysts see it taking market share from Intel
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc.'s stock reached fresh records on Tuesday, closing with a market cap of $99.84 billion, just shy of $100 billion. This surge followed an analyst's price target hike and strong earnings reports, indicating an accelerating market share gain from Intel Corp. The company briefly surpassed a $100 billion market cap intraday.

title: AMD closes just shy of $100-billion market cap, as more analysts see it taking market share from Intel
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) stock reached a market capitalization just shy of $100 billion after another analyst raised their price target. AMD shares closed up 9.5% at $85.04, setting a new closing record and a market cap of $99.84 billion. This surge follows strong earnings and continued signs that AMD is gaining market share from Intel Corp.

title: Clorox names Linda Rendle CEO
summary: Linda Rendle, a 17-year veteran of The Clorox Co., has been promoted to chief executive officer, effective Sept. 14. This announcement comes as the company posted sales up 22%.

title: McDonald’s (MCD) Earnings: Key numbers from Q2 2020 results
summary: McDonald's (MCD) announced its second quarter financial results for the period ended June 30, 2020, reporting a significant decrease in net income and revenues compared to the previous year. Net income fell to $483.8 million, or $0.65 per share, from $1.52 billion, or $1.97 per share, in Q2 2019. Revenues decreased 30% to $3.76 billion, with systemwide sales down 24%.

title: AMD stock heads toward record high after beating on earnings, raising annual forecast
summary: AMD shares surged in after-hours trading after the company reported better-than-expected second-quarter earnings and raised its annual revenue forecast. The chipmaker now anticipates 2020 revenue to increase about 32% from the previous year, reaching roughly $8.88 billion. This updated guidance surpasses both prior estimates and average analyst expectations.

title: AMD is weathering coronavirus while biggest rival struggles
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) is expected to weather the COVID-19 pandemic due to strong demand for their chips driven by work-from-home and play-from-home trends. This demand for chip-based infrastructure is anticipated to continue throughout the year. However, a prolonged economic downturn could impact this positive outlook.

title: Intel Is Now Ordering Chips From TSMC Following Delays
summary: Intel (INTC) has reportedly placed orders with TSMC (TSM) for 6-nanometer chips, a move considered unprecedented for the prominent chip manufacturer. This decision follows Intel's announcement of significant delays for its 7-nanometer chip until 2022 and confirms its "contingency plans." The news negatively impacted Intel's stock and led analysts to reassess its competitive position against TSMC and AMD.

title: Intel engineering leader Murthy Renduchintala will leave as the company mulls manufacturing shift
summary: Venkata "Murthy" Renduchintala, Intel's chief engineering officer, is resigning on August 3 amidst the company's manufacturing difficulties, particularly with its 7-nanometer architecture. His departure comes as Intel evaluates potentially using outside foundries for chip production, following a significant drop in its stock after Q2 earnings. Renduchintala's group will be split into five, with Ann Kelleher leading the 7-nanometer chip development.

title: Shares of Taiwan’s TSMC soar after Intel’s apparent retreat in chip manufacturing
summary: Shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) rallied significantly after Intel signaled a potential shift away from manufacturing its own chip components, possibly outsourcing to TSMC. This surge made TSMC the 12th most valuable stock globally, briefly surpassing Walmart, and added over US$30 billion to its market capitalization. The event underscores TSMC's growing influence in the global semiconductor industry and its impact on Taiwan's stock market.

title: Intel’s chief engineer out amid manufacturing crisis
summary: Intel's chief engineering officer, Venkata “Murthy” Renduchintala, is leaving the company amidst delays in its next-generation computer chips. This departure is part of several changes Intel is implementing as it struggles with manufacturing issues, including a 12-month delay for its 7nm chips. The news led to a significant drop in Intel's stock value and has prompted the company to explore outsourcing chip production.

title: Intel's 7nm is Broken, Company Announces Delay Until 2022, 2023
summary: Intel announced a significant delay in the rollout of its 7nm CPUs, pushing their debut to late 2022 or early 2023. This delay is attributed to a "defect mode" causing yield degradation, putting Intel approximately twelve months behind its internal targets for 7nm process. The company is now exploring contingency plans, including the use of third-party foundries for some components and entire chip designs, and plans to increase shipments of 10nm chips by 20%.

title: Intel has weathered coronavirus because of data center and PC sales, but only one of those is expected to grow
summary: Intel is projected to experience strong sales growth in its data center business throughout the remainder of the year due to companies' continued migration to the cloud. However, the demand for PC sales is expected to reach a saturation point. The company is set to report its quarterly earnings after market close on Thursday.

title: A visual dashboard of Capital One Financial Q2 2020 earnings
summary: Capital One Financial (NYSE: COF) reported an 8% slip in Q2 revenue to $6.6 billion, missing Wall Street projections, while net loss of $1.61 per share was narrower than analysts' projection. Following the announcement, COF shares fell 3.3%, and the stock has declined nearly 40% since the beginning of the year. Investors are looking forward to management/analyst comments on the Q2 results.

title: Analog Devices Acquires Maxim in an Underwhelming $21 Billion Bet
summary: Analog Devices (ADI) is acquiring Maxim Integrated Products in a $21 billion all-stock deal, aiming to strengthen its position in analog semiconductors and diversify its portfolio. While ADI anticipates increased scale and market presence, the analyst expresses concerns about the competitive landscape in network infrastructure and data center semiconductors, as well as challenges related to supply chain integration. The article suggests that ADI may struggle to fully realize the acquisition's benefits in certain competitive segments and faces integration hurdles.

title: Lisa Su : Awards
summary: This article profiles Lisa Su, President and CEO of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), highlighting her journey from Taiwan to becoming a leading figure in the technology sector. It details her educational background at MIT, her impactful career at IBM and Freescale Semiconductor, and her instrumental role in turning around AMD's financial performance by expanding its focus beyond PC products. The piece also notes her significant awards and contributions to research and recovery efforts during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: New PCIe 4.0 SSDs, 24 Gbps SAS SSDs supply bandwidth boost
summary: Major drive manufacturers are rolling out new enterprise SSDs supporting PCIe Gen 4 and 24 Gbps SAS to significantly increase bandwidth for data centers. Companies like Kioxia, Intel, and Western Digital are introducing these faster options, though adoption of PCIe Gen 4 is currently limited by processor compatibility and customer demand. The article also highlights continued strong demand for SAS SSDs, particularly in storage array markets.

title: Intel stock slips as new lines of AI chips released
summary: Intel stock experienced a decline after the company launched new artificial intelligence and data analytics chips. The company's shares fell by 1.2%, underperforming the broader market. This occurred despite new product introductions aimed at supporting AI and data analytics.

title: Apple, ARM, and Intel
summary: This article discusses Apple's anticipated transition of its Mac computers from Intel processors to its own ARM-based chips, highlighting the historical context of this decision, Intel's manufacturing struggles, and the potential implications for performance and the broader server market. It also critically examines Intel's past strategic missteps, particularly its decision regarding iPhone chip production.

title: NXP Selects TSMC 5nm Process for Next Generation High Performance Automotive Platform
summary: NXP Semiconductors and TSMC have announced a collaboration to use TSMC's 5-nanometer (5nm) technology for NXP's next-generation high-performance automotive platform. This partnership aims to transform automobiles into powerful computing systems, addressing various functions like autonomous driving, connected cockpits, and hybrid propulsion control. The 5nm process will enable NXP to deliver enhanced performance, power efficiency, and advanced safety and security features for future vehicle architectures.

title: Intel Loses a Chip Wizard at the Worst Possible Time
summary: Intel's top chip architect, Jim Keller, resigned effective immediately for personal reasons after only two years with the company. This departure is seen as a significant blow to Intel, which is already ceding ground to rivals in a competitive market, and comes at a challenging time for the chip giant. Keller's extensive experience from companies like Apple and AMD highlights the severity of his exit for Intel.

title: Former Apple executive Jim Keller resigns from top chip design role at Intel
summary: Jim Keller, a prominent chip designer known for his work at Apple, Tesla, and AMD, has resigned from his role at Intel for personal reasons. His departure raises concerns among analysts about Intel's processor roadmap and vulnerability to competition, especially with Apple reportedly planning to use its own chips in Macs. Keller will serve as a consultant for Intel for six months during the transition.

title: Intel loses ‘rock star’ chip designer Jim Keller
summary: Intel Corp. has announced the departure of its celebrated chip designer, Jim Keller, who is leaving for "personal reasons" after two years with the company. Keller, known for his work at AMD, Apple, and Tesla, was instrumental in Intel's efforts to expand beyond traditional PC and server chips into new markets like AI and cloud computing. Despite his departure, Intel has already reorganized its engineering leadership and Keller will serve as a consultant for six months to ensure a smooth transition.

title: AMD CEO Lisa Su Tops Earnings as Highest Paid CEO in The S&P 500
summary: AMD CEO Lisa Su has become the highest-paid CEO in the S&P 500, with a pay package valued at $58.5 million. This compensation is attributed to AMD's impressive performance over the past five years, driven by the success of EPYC, Ryzen, and Radeon products. Lisa Su is also the first woman to hold this distinction, being one of only 20 women on the list compared to 309 men.

title: AMD Stock Pushes Lisa Su to Top of CEO Compensation List
summary: Lisa Su, CEO of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), topped the annual CEO compensation survey by the Associated Press in 2019 with a $58.5 million pay package, largely due to AMD's strong stock performance. She is the first woman to achieve this No. 1 ranking. Her leadership is credited with turning around AMD, focusing the company on high-growth areas like high-performance computing, computer graphics, and graphics processing units.

title: AMD’s Lisa Su Takes The No. 1 Position As S&P 500’s Highest Paid CEO
summary: Dr. Lisa Su, CEO of AMD, has been identified as the highest-paid chief executive in the S&P 500 for 2019, with total compensation of $58.5 million, a 338% year-over-year growth. Her compensation was largely comprised of stock awards, reflecting AMD's significant stock market gains and market share growth under her leadership. The article details AMD's recent performance, including strong notebook sales and GPU market share increases, and touches upon upcoming product plans.

title: What Is a DPU?
summary: This article explains what a Data Processing Unit (DPU) is and how it differs from CPUs and GPUs, positioning it as the third pillar of computing. It details the key components of a DPU, including a multi-core CPU, high-performance network interface, and acceleration engines, emphasizing its role in modern data centers and SmartNICs. The article also outlines ten critical capabilities for network data path acceleration engines within a DPU.

title: Why Intel is betting its chips on microprocessor mastermind Jim Keller
summary: This article profiles Jim Keller, a legendary microprocessor designer who has worked for Apple, Tesla, and AMD, and is now tasked with revitalizing Intel's chip-design enterprise. It explores his unconventional career path, his philosophy of simplification and learning, and the significant impact his designs have had on the tech industry, including the Ryzen chips for AMD and the Autopilot chip for Tesla. The piece details how Intel is relying on Keller to overcome its recent struggles and regain its market leadership.

title: Baidu Inc. (NASDAQ: BIDU) Q1 2020 Earnings Infographic
summary: Baidu Inc. (NASDAQ: BIDU) reported Q1 2020 unaudited financial results, surpassing analyst expectations despite a 7% year-over-year revenue decline attributed to diversified streams. The company saw robust traffic with Baidu App DAUs up 28% and iQIYI subscribers reaching 118.9 million. Baidu also approved a $1 billion share repurchase program and projects Q2 2020 revenue between $3.5-3.9 billion.

title: TDS Telecom Internet outage : Internet down (not working) for many users
summary: TDS Telecom is experiencing an internet outage affecting users in multiple locations, as confirmed by numerous user complaints on Twitter and reported by Down Detector. The company, which provides services in 32 U.S. states, has not yet issued an official statement regarding the situation. Updates will be provided as more information becomes available.

title: Networking Devices & Hardware Products For HPC
summary: Supermicro offers a comprehensive range of networking devices and hardware products optimized for High Performance Computing (HPC) and data centers. Their offerings include cost-effective ToR switches, flexible Open Networking platforms, and field-proven standard switches, all designed for high availability and efficient data transmission. Key products like the Supermicro SIOM deliver significant I/O cost savings and support a wide spectrum of networking speeds for various applications.

title: TSMC Announces Intention to Build and Operate an Advanced Semiconductor Fab in the United States
summary: TSMC announced its plan to build and operate an advanced semiconductor fab in the U.S. state of Arizona. This facility will use 5nm technology, have a capacity of 20,000 wafers per month, create over 1,600 high-tech jobs directly, and involves a total investment of approximately US$12 billion from 2021 to 2029. The project is strategically important for the U.S. semiconductor ecosystem and relies on continued U.S. federal government and Arizona state support.

title: TSMC, maker of iPhone chips, to build $12bn chip factory in US
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC), a major supplier to Apple Inc., announced plans to build a $12 billion chip factory in Arizona, in partnership with the US government. This move aligns with the Trump administration's efforts to increase foreign manufacturing in the US and will create up to 1,600 jobs, producing advanced 5-nanometer chips. The investment highlights the strategic importance of semiconductor production within the US amidst growing US-China trade tensions.

title: Taiwanese Chipmaker Plans to Build $12 Billion Factory in Arizona
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) plans to invest $12 billion in building a new chip plant in Arizona, with construction expected to begin in 2021 and completion by 2024. This move is intended to address U.S. national security concerns and shift high-tech manufacturing to the U.S., while also balancing TSMC's relationships with both American clients and China. The facility will create 1,600 jobs and utilize 5-nanometer process technology, though the scale is relatively small compared to TSMC's overall operations.

title: Nvidia confirms Ampere will power next-gen GeForce graphics cards
summary: Nvidia has confirmed that its new Ampere GPU architecture will power next-gen GeForce graphics cards, unifying its entire GPU range from gaming to data centers. CEO Jen-Hsun Huang announced that Ampere will replace both Turing and Volta chips, with the architecture also being used in supercomputers to aid in COVID-19 research. While a specific release date for gaming cards wasn't given, an August/September announcement is anticipated.

title: Nvidia Unveils New Data Center Chips to Speed Pace of AI
summary: Nvidia Corp. announced new Ampere graphics chips and computers for AI processing in data centers, claiming a 20x performance increase over predecessors. These new chips are designed to handle both AI training and inference tasks, a capability that will bolster Nvidia's leadership in the growing AI market. The company is selling Ampere-based computers called DGX for $199,000 each, touting their superior performance compared to traditional Intel-based server arrays.

title: COVID-19 Impact and Recovery Analysis | Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) Market 2020-2024 | Demand for High Memory GPU to Boost Growth | Technavio
summary: Technavio projects the Graphics Processing Unit (GPU) market to grow by USD 38.28 billion between 2020 and 2024, with a CAGR exceeding 29%. This growth is primarily driven by the increasing demand for high-memory GPUs, coupled with the expansion of the PC gaming and gaming console markets. The report provides an in-depth analysis of market trends, vendor landscapes, and the impact of COVID-19, segmenting the market by device type and geography.

title: Nvidia shares heading for first record close since coronavirus pandemic
summary: Nvidia shares are on track for a record close, recovering from a COVID-19 related drop, after an analyst boosted the price target ahead of earnings. The analyst cited Nvidia's acquisition of Mellanox Technologies and increased demand for gaming chips and data-center spending as reasons for the upgrade. The company's stock has risen significantly year-to-date, outperforming semiconductor and S&P 500 indexes.

title: Micro but mighty: Semiconductors remain the key to technology leadership
summary: The article emphasizes the critical role of semiconductors in the 21st-century information economy, likening data to "oil" but stressing that semiconductors translate data into usable information. It highlights the United States' historical dominance in this field and its efforts to defend against challenges from countries like Japan in the 1980s and more recently China. The author argues that the U.S. needs a broader strategy beyond export restrictions, involving close collaboration with allies, especially Japan, to maintain its technological leadership.

title: SmartPay, AMD, Welspun Settlement Checks Mailed
summary: Settlement checks are being mailed to consumers from three class action lawsuits involving SmartPay, Welspun, and AMD. The SmartPay settlement addresses allegations of unwanted text messages, with checks of $279 being distributed. The Welspun settlement, which paid out $36 million, compensates consumers who purchased mislabeled "Egyptian Cotton" or "Pima Cotton" products, with payouts ranging from $1.15 to $9.20 per item. The AMD CPUs settlement, totaling $12.1 million, provides up to $152 for consumers who purchased CPUs that were allegedly misrepresented as having more cores than they actually did.

title: AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) Reports 41% Year-Over-Year Revenue Growth, Record Notebook Sales
summary: AMD reported Q1 FY2020 earnings with $1.79 billion in revenue, marking a 41% year-over-year growth, despite missing Wall Street analyst expectations and its own previous guidance. The company saw strong performance in Ryzen and EPYC processors and record notebook sales, although overall sequential revenue dropped. AMD remains optimistic about Q2 FY2020, forecasting 21% year-over-year revenue growth.

title: Northern Trust (NASDAQ: NTRS) Q1 2020 Earnings Infographic
summary: Northern Trust (NASDAQ: NTRS) reported a 4% rise in Q1 2020 earnings, driven by higher revenue and strong momentum before the pandemic's partial impact. Despite a 3% decline in net interest income, non-interest income jumped 35% due to increased client volumes and market volatility. The company highlighted its strong capital base and liquidity as crucial during turbulent times.

title: AMD's Ryzen 3 3100 and 3300X are the fastest Ryzen 3 desktop chips ever
summary: AMD has announced two new entry-level processors, the Ryzen 3 3100 and Ryzen 3 3300X, which are built on the Zen 2 7nm platform and support PCIe 4.0. These chips are touted as the fastest Ryzen 3 desktop processors ever, featuring four cores and eight threads, with the 3300X offering higher clock speeds. Both processors include a Wraith Stealth thermal solution and a 65W TDP.

title: HP's new ProBooks run on AMD's Ryzen 4000 series processors
summary: HP announced two new ProBook laptops, the 445 G7 and 455 G7, which are the first HP commercial products to utilize AMD's Ryzen 4000 series processors. These business-focused laptops include advanced security features and are designed for durability, featuring an 180-degree hinge and passing 19 MIL-STG 810G tests. Both models are expected to be available in late April 2020.

title: GlobalFoundries Has Quietly Become A Player In Silicon Photonics Manufacturing
summary: GlobalFoundries has quietly established itself as a significant player in silicon photonics manufacturing, now holding at least 10% of the foundry market share. This position was achieved through strategic acquisitions, such as IBM's Microelectronics business in 2015, and key partnerships with companies like Ayar Labs and MACOM Technology Solutions Inc. The article highlights GF's roadmap, including its 90nm and future 45CLO platforms, aimed at addressing the growing demand for higher bandwidth in data centers and 5G networks.

title: India’s Top 10 National Distribution Companies
summary: This article lists India's top 10 national distribution companies in the IT sector, highlighting their crucial role in connecting technology brands with the Indian market. It provides profiles for each company, including their leadership, addresses, websites, and key business activities. The article emphasizes the growing importance of these distributors in the Indian ICT market and acknowledges their evolution beyond traditional "box movers."

title: Hacker allegedly steals AMD Navi 21 and Xbox Series X GPU test files, demands $100 million
summary: A hacker allegedly stole test files for AMD's Navi 21 GPU and the Xbox Series X's Arden GPU, demanding $100 million to prevent a full leak. AMD confirmed a "subset" of test files were compromised but stated they are not critical to product competitiveness or security, adding that authorities are investigating the incident. The hack highlights potential security vulnerabilities at AMD.

title: AMD's Ryzen Mobile 4000 H-series arrives to give gamers a real choice again
summary: AMD's new Ryzen Mobile 4000 H-series processors are launched, aiming to compete directly with Intel in the gaming laptop market. These 45W chips, first revealed at CES 2020, promise significant performance gains over Intel's 9th Gen chips, including the Core i7-9750H and i9-9880H. The H-series, featuring Ryzen 5 and Ryzen 7 options with up to 8 cores and 16 threads, are designed for gaming laptops and professional creator machines.

title: Everspin Technologies and GLOBALFOUNDRIES Extend MRAM Joint Development Agreement to 12nm
summary: Everspin Technologies and GLOBALFOUNDRIES have extended their Spin-transfer Torque (STT-MRAM) joint development agreement to include a future project on an advanced 12 nm FinFET MRAM solution. This partnership previously covered 40 nm, 28 nm, and 22 nm STT-MRAM processes. The extension aims to further solidify their mutual technology leadership and advance STT-MRAM as a future memory technology, particularly eyeing its use in microcontroller and IoT applications.

title: Opinion: AMD shows that it’s not resting on its laurels with ambitious road map
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. demonstrated at its annual analyst meeting that it is not complacent after being the top performer in the S&P 500 last year. The company presented an ambitious road map with new chip architectures and aggressive goals, making a strong case for investors to continue trusting CEO Lisa Su. AMD aims for continued strong growth despite fierce competition from Intel Corp.

title: What Market Volatility Tells Us About Semiconductors
summary: During periods of elevated market volatility, technology, specifically semiconductors, have led the market downward, continuing a trend from the past two years. Investors punish semiconductors more than broader tech, indicating continued lack of confidence. Despite potential optimism from 5G rollout, headwinds persist.

title: Dow's point drop worst on record as stocks fall into correction
summary: U.S. equity markets plunged into correction territory on Thursday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average experiencing its worst single point drop ever, falling over 1,193 points. The sell-off was fueled by growing concerns over the coronavirus outbreak, leading to significant losses across the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite, and impacting various sectors including technology, airlines, and oil. The market volatility occurred after President Trump announced a coronavirus task force and new cases of the virus were reported globally.

title: Nvidia forecast tops expectations on cloud sales despite coronavirus hit
summary: Nvidia Corp exceeded Wall Street's first-quarter revenue expectations, driven by strong sales of its chips to cloud computing vendors, despite projecting a $100 million hit due to the coronavirus outbreak. This forecast signals a rebound in chip demand, particularly in the data center business, which helped offset a slight miss in gaming revenue and increased Nvidia's shares. The company expects current-quarter revenue of $3 billion, plus or minus 2%.

title: AMD stock could hit $66, says Wall Street’s most upbeat analyst
summary: RBC Capital Markets analyst Mitch Steves has raised his price target for AMD stock to $66, making it the highest among analysts covering the stock. This revised target comes after positive earnings from Nvidia Corp., which suggested a healthy market for gaming chips and minimal impact of the coronavirus on AMD's full-year 2020 results. AMD shares rallied on Friday following this bullish update.

title: Windows 10 Pro can't handle the AMD Threadripper 3990X's 128 threads
summary: The article discusses how Windows 10 Pro and Home editions cannot fully utilize the 128 threads of the AMD Threadripper 3990X processor. To leverage the CPU's full potential, users need to upgrade to Windows 10 Pro for Workstations or Windows 10 Enterprise, or rely on programs designed to be processor group aware. There's also a mention of a potential Windows 10 Pro update that might address this issue.

title: Opinion: The problem with AMD’s data-center business
summary: This article argues that Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) needs to be more transparent about its server-chip sales to investors if it's serious about its data-center business. The chip manufacturer recently missed revenue expectations in its combined enterprise/data center/semi-custom business, causing its stock to tumble. As server-chip sales are a significant driver for investment, the lack of separate reporting for this segment is problematic.

title: A hidden stock tip in Apple earnings? Watch these semiconductor companies, analyst says
summary: Following Apple's strong earnings and stock performance, an analyst suggests watching its semiconductor suppliers. B. Riley analyst Craig Ellis highlighted Skyworks Solutions as a "buy" with a significant price target, indicating potential gains for the company and other major chip suppliers to Apple. This comes after Apple's CEO noted double-digit growth in various markets during their recent earnings call.

title: One Stop Systems follows up record revenue in 2019 with addition to “AI on the Fly” line
summary: One Stop Systems (OSS) reported record revenue of $58.3 million in 2019, a 57 percent gain over the previous year, driven by corporate acquisitions and new design wins in enterprise and military markets. The company is expanding its "AI on the Fly" product line with a new PCIe 4.0 value expansion system that incorporates the NVIDIA V100S Tensor Core GPU. This addition aims to meet the growing demand for high-performance edge computing systems capable of processing AI algorithms closer to data sources, particularly in mission-critical applications.

title: AMD stock logs worst day since summer trade war fears as ‘conservative’ outlook gives pause
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares experienced their worst day since August due to concerns over a conservative outlook and soft console chip sales, despite strong data-center revenue. More than half of the analysts covering the stock increased their price targets, indicating underlying confidence even after the 6% stock drop.

title: AMD stock slides as forecast, data-center segment come in lower than expected
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) stock slid after the company's fourth-quarter earnings report revealed a lower-than-expected forecast for the first quarter and its data-center segment disappointed. AMD expects Q1 revenue between $1.75 billion and $1.85 billion, below analyst estimates of $1.86 billion, though full-year revenue growth projections were largely in line with expectations. The decline in the data-center segment was attributed to gaming consoles by executives and analysts.

title: AMD chief Lisa Su joins Cisco board as networking giant touts 5G, silicon products
