summary: Lisa Su, CEO of Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), has joined the board of Cisco Systems. This appointment comes as Cisco is launching new software, silicon, and router products, while AMD has recently achieved record revenues and an all-time high stock price under Su's leadership.

title: Qualcomm Technologies launches new snapdragon mobile platforms
summary: Qualcomm Technologies announced the launch of three new 4G mobile platforms: Snapdragon 720G, 662, and 460, designed to enhance user experiences in connectivity, gaming, and entertainment, particularly for regions like India. These platforms feature improved AI capabilities, advanced camera support, and enhanced location positioning with NavIC integration, catering to various market segments. Devices integrating these new platforms are expected to be commercially available throughout 2020.

title: Corsair Launches Vengeance 6100 Gaming PCs With Powerful AMD Ryzen 3000 CPUs, Radeon Navi GPUs
summary: Corsair has introduced new Vengeance 6180 and Vengeance 6182 gaming PCs, featuring AMD Ryzen 7 3700X processors and Radeon RX 5700 XT graphics cards. While both systems share many core components, the 6182 model offers a higher-end motherboard and a larger PCIe 4.0 SSD compared to the 6180. Interestingly, both models are currently priced identically at $1,999, which Corsair is investigating.

title: AMD Hires Top Intel Exec Dan McNamara To Grow EPYC Business
summary: AMD has appointed former top Intel executive Dan McNamara as senior vice president and general manager of its Server Business Unit to further develop the EPYC server processor business. This strategic hire, announced alongside four other senior executive promotions, aims to strengthen AMD's leadership team and build on its recent momentum. McNamara will report to Forrest Norrod and is taking over from Scott Aylor, who is departing later this year.

title: Investors Love Thematic ETFs and Mutual Funds, but They Aren’t Always Loved Back - WSJ
authors: Tyler Comrie By Michael A. Pollock
summary: Thematic ETFs and mutual funds are popular among investors, allowing them to invest in specific trends like AI, clean energy, or space. However, these funds can often disappoint despite investor enthusiasm. The article suggests strategies for investors to better manage their thematic fund investments.

title: Here are the best and worst Dow and S&P 500 stocks of 2019
summary: The article highlights the best and worst performing stocks in the Dow Jones Industrial Average and S&P 500 for the year 2019. Apple led the Dow with an 86% return, while AMD was the top performer in the S&P 500. This strong market performance is attributed to the Federal Reserve's interest rate cuts and foreign capital flowing into the U.S.

title: Here are the best-performing Nasdaq stocks of 2019
summary: This article highlights the best-performing Nasdaq stocks of 2019, specifically mentioning AMD, Lam Research, and KLA as top performers. It notes the Nasdaq Composite Index reaching 9,000 points for the first time and briefly discusses the index's market capitalization weighting, with Apple, Microsoft, Amazon.com, Facebook, and Alphabet making up a significant portion of its value. The article promises to provide additional lists of winners for the year.

title: Here are the best-performing Nasdaq stocks of 2019
summary: This article highlights the top-performing Nasdaq stocks of 2019, following the Nasdaq Composite Index's rise past 9,000 points for the first time. AMD, Lam Research, and KLA are identified as leading the list of winners. It also notes that the five largest components—Apple, Microsoft, Amazon.com, Facebook, and Google holding company Alphabet—constitute 36% of the index's market value.

title: Intel Buys Israeli AI Chipmaker Habana Labs for $2 Billion
summary: Intel Corp. acquired Israeli AI chipmaker Habana Labs for approximately $2 billion to strengthen its position in the rapidly expanding artificial intelligence silicon market. This acquisition is part of Intel's strategy to make its offerings essential to major silicon buyers and compete against companies like Alphabet's Google and Amazon's AWS, which are increasingly designing their own chips for data centers. Habana Labs is expected to operate independently for the time being.

title: Intel hires former GlobalFoundries, IBM chip executive
summary: Intel Corp has hired Gary Patton, former chief technology officer at GlobalFoundries and a veteran of IBM's chip unit, as corporate vice president and general manager of design enablement. This move continues Intel's strategy of bringing in high-profile executives from competitors, following previous hires from Advanced Micro Devices and Qualcomm. Patton is recognized for his skill in transitioning research and development into practical chip factory applications.

title: HKSTP and UMEC Organise First AI Chips Summit
summary: The Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation (HKSTP) and United Microelectronics Centre (UMEC) jointly organized the first AI Chips Summit to promote the development of an Artificial Intelligence hardware ecosystem. The summit brought together global technology experts, industry players, academics, and Park company representatives to discuss advanced machine learning-based design methodologies and tools for AI chips and accelerators. HKSTP emphasized its ongoing efforts to support AI and innovative technology development through initiatives like iDM 2 Micro-Electronics Node and AI Plug@HKSTP.
source: Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation (HKSTP)
source_domain: Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation (HKSTP)

title: AMD share price up 120% in 2019; Strong outlook for 2020
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares surged 120% in 2019, reaching their highest level since 2006, fueled by strong Q3 results, positive developments in the US-China trade deal, and the successful launch of new Ryzen processors. The company's high price-earnings ratio of 219.44x indicates investor confidence in future growth, with CEO Lisa Su expressing optimism for 2020 and beyond due to a strong product portfolio and market momentum.

title: AMD Ryzen 9 3900X review: Amazing multi-core CPU performance at an unbelievable price
summary: This article reviews the AMD Ryzen 9 3900X, highlighting its exceptional multi-core performance and competitive pricing which allows it to challenge Intel's high-end offerings. The review emphasizes the CPU's 12 cores, 24 threads, PCIe 4.0 support, and AM4 compatibility, positioning it as a strong contender for demanding tasks like video editing and gaming. It concludes that the Ryzen 9 3900X offers incredible value and performance, making the desktop CPU market more competitive and beneficial for consumers.

title: AMD Radeon™ Pro 5000M Series Mobile GPUs Bring High-Performance AMD RDNA Architecture to Apple’s New 16-inch MacBook Pro
summary: AMD announced that its new Radeon Pro 5500M and 5300M mobile GPUs, based on the 7nm AMD RDNA architecture, will power Apple's new 16-inch MacBook Pro. These are the first 7nm discrete mobile GPUs for professional users, offering up to 4.0 TFLOPS of performance and up to 8GB of GDDR6 memory to enhance video editing, 3D content creation, and macOS game development. The GPUs aim to provide creative professionals with powerful visual fidelity for demanding applications.

title: Intel Speeds AI Development, Deployment and Performance with New Class of AI Hardware from Cloud to Edge
summary: Intel announced new AI hardware, including the Intel Nervana Neural Network Processors (NNP-T1000 and NNP-I1000) for training and inference, and its next-generation Intel Movidius Myriad Vision Processing Unit (VPU). These products are designed to accelerate AI development and deployment from cloud to edge, further strengthening Intel's AI solutions portfolio, which is expected to generate over $3.5 billion in revenue in 2019. The company also introduced the Intel DevCloud for the Edge to help developers prototype AI solutions on Intel processors.

title: The Importance of Thermal Management for Power Devices
summary: This article discusses the critical role of thermal management in power devices to prevent overheating and ensure reliability, especially with the miniaturization of electronic systems. It highlights the challenges faced by the electronics industry in obtaining sufficient thermal information and introduces the Cadence Celsius Thermal Solver as a comprehensive solution for electric-thermal co-simulation across the entire hierarchy of electronic systems. The article explains the physics of thermal resistance and outlines various thermal tools and techniques, including 3D ICs and TSVs, emphasizing the need for integrated electrical and thermal analyses for optimal design.

title: Nvidia's Jensen Huang named top-performing CEO of 2019
summary: Nvidia Corp. co-founder and CEO Jensen Huang has been named the No. 1 top-performing CEO globally by Harvard Business Review for his 26 years at the helm and the significant rise in the company's stock price. The article highlights Huang's achievement and briefly mentions other Bay Area CEOs who also ranked. It also lists related articles concerning Bay Area tech and executive news.

title: AMD reports highest revenue in more than a decade, but slightly light forecast makes stock volatile
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) reported its highest quarterly sales in over a decade, but a slightly light forecast caused its stock to be volatile in after-hours trading. The company's third-quarter net income increased, and adjusted earnings per share met analyst expectations, although revenue was just under forecasts. Despite strong revenue growth, the cautious outlook led to uncertainty among investors.

title: Ford Motor (F) Q3 earnings beat; stock falls on weak guidance
summary: Ford Motor Company reported better-than-expected third-quarter earnings despite a revenue decline, yet its stock fell due to trimmed full-year guidance. The company lowered its full-year adjusted EBIT guidance to $6.5 billion-$7.0 billion, citing increased warranty costs, higher incentives in North America, and reduced volumes in China. Adjusted earnings per share are now projected to be $1.20-$1.32 for the full year.

title: Semiconductor stocks are poised to benefit as industry sales growth resumes in 2020
summary: Semiconductor stocks are expected to see a rebound in sales growth in 2020 after a challenging 2019, which is considered a "reset" year. Despite their volatility, these stocks have historically been excellent long-term investments. The industry has been particularly affected by the U.S.-China trade conflict, but analysts project a significant sales increase for companies like Nvidia next year.

title: IBD Stock Of The Day: ASML Holding Breaks Out To New High
summary: ASML Holding (ASML) broke out to a new high on Thursday from a three-weeks-tight pattern, near a buy point of $252.21. The stock's relative strength line is at a record high, with a Relative Strength rating of 96. This breakout follows previous flat base-on-base and cup-with-handle patterns.

title: Apple says Mac Pro manufacturing will remain in Austin
summary: Apple announced on Monday that it will continue manufacturing its Mac Pro computers in Austin, Texas, reversing earlier reports of a potential move to China. This decision comes after the company secured tariff exemptions from the U.S. government for key imported parts, allowing it to avoid additional costs. Apple (AAPL) emphasized its commitment to U.S. manufacturing and its significant investment in the American economy, including its operations and planned expansion in Austin.

title: Intel promotes two Oregon execs to EVP roles
summary: Intel has promoted two Oregon-based executives to EVP roles, enhancing their influence within the company. This move signals the added weight attributed to these leaders and their contributions to the organization. The promotions highlight Intel's recognition of talent within its Oregon operations.

title: Intel 5G Exec Cormac Conroy Departs Company
summary: Cormac Conroy, an Intel executive who led the company's 5G modem efforts, resigned from Intel just before the company announced the sale of most of its smartphone modem business to Apple. Despite this departure and the sale, Intel states that LTE and 5G connectivity remain important for its PC business and Project Athena innovation program. Conroy's resignation follows Intel's decision earlier in the year to exit the 5G smartphone modem business, a move that aligns with Apple's reported efforts to recruit talent from Intel's 5G team.

title: Taking a Look Under the Hood of VanEck’s Video Gaming and Esports ETF
summary: This article provides an in-depth look at the holdings within VanEck's Video Gaming and Esports ETF (ESPO), highlighting key companies from both Asia-Pacific and the U.S. It discusses the performance and business models of leading firms like Sea Limited, Bandai Namco, Square Enix, Advanced Micro Devices, Zynga, and Activision Blizzard. The article suggests that investing in a diversified ETF can offer targeted exposure to the high-growth video gaming and esports sector.

title: Beamr Delivers World's First 8K Live HEVC Software Video Encoder powered by an AMD EPYC™ Processor In Time for Tokyo 2020 Olympics
summary: Beamr announced a world record in video encoding benchmark, demonstrating its Beamr 5 software operating on a single-socket AMD EPYC™ 7742 processor to achieve 79 frames per second in real-time at 8K resolution with 10-bit color. This achievement positions Beamr and AMD to support the growing demand for 8K content, especially with events like the Tokyo 2020 Olympics nearing. The high-performance software solution offers flexibility for various resolutions and is critical for the evolving video distribution industry.

title: Can Taiwan keep its perch as top chip manufacturer?
authors: Li Tao in Shenzhen and Chua Kong Ho in Hong Kong
summary: Taiwan's journey to becoming a top chip manufacturer began in 1974 with a US$10 million investment and a crucial technology transfer from RCA in 1976. This article, part of a series, examines Taiwan's rise in chip production with US help and the current challenges it faces, particularly from China, as detailed by key figures like MediaTek chairman Tsai Ming-kai.

title: Ushio’s Breakthrough In The Niche Extreme Ultraviolet Lithography market
summary: Ushio (TYO:6925) has achieved a breakthrough in the Extreme Ultraviolet (EUV) lithography market by perfecting a light source for testing patterned EUV masks, a critical component for enabling next-generation semiconductor manufacturing at nodes lower than 7nm. This innovation fills a crucial gap in the industry, positioning Ushio as a sole supplier for this niche and vital technology. The CEO, Koji Naito, highlighted that testing equipment was a bottleneck for EUV and their solution will boost production efficiency and yields, with the technology expected to turn profitable in the next fiscal year.

title: Here are 2019’s biggest stock market winners and losers in the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq
summary: This article reviews the biggest stock market winners and losers across the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq for 2019 up to August 29th. It highlights top performers like Chipotle, AMD, Apple, and Visa, and notes disappointing results for Macy’s and Kraft Heinz. Despite ongoing media narratives, the U.S. stock market has shown strong returns year-to-date, with the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq Composite Index all posting significant gains.

title: Here are 2019’s biggest stock market winners and losers in the Dow, S&P 500 and Nasdaq
summary: This article identifies the top stock market performers and laggards in the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq for 2019 as of August 29. It highlights strong market performance despite negative headlines, with the Dow rising 13%, the S&P 500 climbing 16.8%, and the Nasdaq Composite jumping 20%. Apple is noted as a strong performer in the Dow.

title: Dell Latitude 5300 Laptop Review: A small business laptop with LTE
summary: The Dell Latitude 5300 is reviewed as a compact and lightweight business laptop offering optional LTE and a matte touchscreen. It features an Intel Core i5-8365U CPU, UHD Graphics 620, and up to 32 GB RAM. While praised for its security features, connectivity, and performance for office tasks, it receives criticism for heat management under load and a shorter-than-expected battery life despite its large capacity.

title: Nvidia jumps on earnings beat
summary: Nvidia's stock rose after reporting better-than-expected fiscal second-quarter earnings, beating analyst estimates for both revenue and earnings per share. Despite an annualized revenue decline of 17%, driven by decreases in gaming and data center segments, the company offered optimistic guidance for the third quarter's gross margin. Analysts noted a potential return to normalcy in the second half of 2019, citing strong market positioning for Nvidia's GPUs.

title: AMD stock rebounds from earnings disappointment with new server chip
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) shares are rising following optimism over its new second-generation Epyc 2 server chip, codenamed Rome. AMD announced that Rome offers nearly double the performance of Intel Corp.'s Xeon processor at approximately half the cost. This news comes after the company's recent earnings disappointment and could potentially impact Intel's stock.

title: Marvell Unveils Industry’s Lowest Power PCIe Gen4 NVMe SSD Controllers
summary: Marvell has introduced the industry's lowest power PCIe Gen4 NVMe SSD controller portfolio, designed for next-generation data centers and edge devices. These new controllers offer unparalleled performance-power benefits, leveraging 12nm process technology and supporting various form factors. Industry leaders like AMD, Lenovo's Union Memory, Micron Technology, and Toshiba Memory Corporation have expressed support for Marvell's new technology, highlighting its potential to enable innovative, low-power, and high-performance SSD solutions.

title: AstraZeneca Plc Q2 2019 earnings
summary: AstraZeneca Plc (NYSE: AZN) reported Q2 2019 earnings that surpassed market expectations for both revenue and earnings, leading to a 4.7% premarket stock increase. Total revenue grew 13% year-over-year to $5.8 billion, driven by a 51% increase in Oncology sales, while core EPS rose 5% to $0.73. The company also raised its product sales growth forecast for fiscal year 2019 and reiterated its core EPS guidance.

title: ServiceNow (NOW) Q2 2019 earnings results
summary: ServiceNow reported strong Q2 2019 earnings, with a 32% jump in revenues to $833.9 million and net income rising to 71 cents per share, surpassing analyst projections. Despite these positive results, the company's shares fell 5% post-market due to valuation concerns. ServiceNow also provided an optimistic outlook for subscription revenue and billings growth for Q3 and the full year 2019, driven by cloud adoption and strategic partnerships.

title: Intel (INTC) Q2 2019 earnings preview
summary: Intel is expected to report a decline in Q2 2019 earnings and revenue, with analysts forecasting a 13% drop in EPS and a 7.5% drop in revenue. Investors will be keenly watching the company's guidance for the third quarter and the second half of 2019 after a weaker-than-expected 2019 outlook previously hit the stock. Recent reports indicate an easing of Intel CPU shortages, which alongside new product plans for AI, 5G, and autonomous driving, and long-term revenue targets, will also be of interest.

title: Is AMD Ryzen 9 3900X good for gaming?
summary: The article confirms that the AMD Ryzen 9 3900X is excellent for gaming, especially when paired with a capable GPU, as it matches Intel's Core i9-9900K in single-core performance. It highlights the processor's 12 cores and 24 threads, making it suitable for both gaming and intensive workloads like video editing and streaming, with recommendations for GPU pairings for various display resolutions.

title: Razer Chroma lighting comes to AMD Ryzen 7 and 9 Wraith Prism fans
summary: Razer has partnered with AMD to integrate Chroma RGB lighting into the Wraith Prism fans included with AMD's new 3rd Gen Ryzen 7 and 9 CPUs. This collaboration allows users to synchronize the lighting of their CPU cooler with other Razer Chroma accessories through the Synapse software, enhancing the aesthetic consistency of gaming setups. The 3rd Gen Ryzen 3000 Series CPUs, with prices starting at $200, are now available, though Chroma integration is exclusive to the Ryzen 7 and 9 chips.

title: Can you game on the AMD Athlon 200GE?
summary: The AMD Athlon 200GE, priced under $60, offers surprisingly good integrated graphics (Vega 3) capable of playing older and lighter games at up to 60 FPS without a dedicated graphics card. While not a high-end gaming chip, it provides a solid entry point for budget PC builds, with benchmarks showing playable frame rates in titles like Dirt Rally, Tomb Raider, and Bioshock Infinite at 720p on low settings. For those seeking more power, the slightly more expensive Ryzen 3 2200G with Vega 8 graphics is suggested as an alternative.

title: Nvidia responds to AMD with ‘Super’ gaming cards
summary: Nvidia launched a new line of "Super" gaming cards, part of its RTX Turing-based series, to compete with rival Advanced Micro Devices Inc. These cards, which enable real-time ray tracing, include the RTX 2060 Super, RTX 2070 Super, and RTX 2080 Super, with release dates in July. An analyst noted that Nvidia's marketing of these chips will be crucial in fending off AMD's challenge.

title: Nvidia responds to AMD with ‘Super’ gaming cards
summary: Nvidia has launched a new "Super" brand line of its RTX Turing-based gaming cards in response to rival Advanced Micro Devices Inc. The new cards, which allow real-time ray tracing, include the RTX 2060 Super, RTX 2070 Super, and RTX 2080 Super, with release dates scheduled throughout July. An analyst suggests Nvidia's marketing of these chips will be crucial in fending off AMD's challenge.

title: AMD Denies Improperly Giving Sensitive Chip Technology to China
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has denied improperly transferring sensitive chip technology to Chinese partners, specifically addressing a Wall Street Journal report. AMD stated that the technology shared in its joint venture (THATIC) was of lower performance and had received Commerce Department approval for transfer, countering claims that it had provided "the keys to the kingdom" of U.S. microprocessor technology. The company emphasized its proper and transparent actions in forming the joint ventures.

title: Super Micro storage server refresh homes in on NVMe flash
summary: Super Micro Computer Inc. has refreshed its storage server lineup, introducing a new BigTwin SuperServer model optimized for EDSFF NVMe flash storage and launching a 1U Petascale Systems line for high ingest rates. These new servers utilize second-generation Intel Xeon Scalable processors and support Intel Optane DC Persistent Memory, addressing the increasing demand for high-performance, dense storage at competitive prices, particularly for AI computing at the edge. The company emphasized that NVMe flash is becoming mainstream, offering significant performance advantages over older SAS and SATA technologies.

title: Can you use the AMD Ryzen 5 2500U for gaming?
summary: The AMD Ryzen 5 2500U is a capable laptop APU with strong integrated Vega graphics, suitable for playing older and lighter games, especially in Ultrabooks. While not a top-tier gaming solution, its integrated GPU outperforms Intel's offerings, making gaming possible, particularly with tweaks to settings and resolution for even more demanding titles. For more serious gaming, it's best paired with a dedicated graphics card in laptops like the Acer Nitro 5.

title: Nova LTD : Quotes, Address, Contact
summary: Nova LTD is a leading innovator and provider of dimensional and materials metrology solutions used in semiconductor manufacturing. The company offers a comprehensive range of metrology solutions, combining high-precision hardware with advanced software modeling. Headquartered in Rehovot, Israel, Nova also has customer operations and service centers globally.

title: AMD stock jumps 10% after detailing new PC push at trade show
summary: AMD's stock surged nearly 10% after the chip maker detailed new product launches at a trade show in Taiwan. An analyst noted that AMD's new CPU represents the first time the company has taken the process-technology and performance lead from Intel in desktop CPUs. This strong performance comes as AMD begins to deliver on its promise of new products in the second half of the year.

title: DEEP FOCUS: Understanding Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock
summary: This article provides a deep dive into Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock, analyzing its market position, competition, product segments, financial trends, and cash flow situation. It highlights AMD's stock performance, its rivalry with Intel, and the anticipated impact of new product launches on its future growth and market share amidst the US-China trade war concerns.

title: This South Korean company has built a 5G search and rescue airship
summary: South Korean telecom giant KT Corp has developed a 5G-connected airship called "Skyship" for search and rescue missions. This innovative airship acts as a flying mothership, deploying drones with high-definition cameras and thermal imaging to locate survivors, and then robots to deliver first aid and connect casualties with medics. The Skyship can also create a secure zone for human rescue teams and is currently in testing, with commercial production planned for next year.

title: “Extend Beyond Moore’s Law”: Xperi Unveils New Semiconductor Wafer Bonding Technology
summary: Xperi Corporation has introduced DBI Ultra, a new IC package bonding technology for semiconductor devices that is a successor to Invensas’s DBI wafer-to-wafer hybrid bonding. This technology enables 2.5D and 3D integration, allowing for higher density and faster memory speeds in applications like 3D stacked memory and integrated memory with CPUs, GPUs, FPGAs, or SoCs. DBI Ultra allows for manufacturing 12- and 16-high HBM stacks, pushing beyond current industry standards and addressing the growing demands on memory and processing speed.

title: With Cray Deal, HPE Finally Enters The HPC Big Leagues
summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) is acquiring supercomputer maker Cray for $1.3 billion, net of Cray's cash, strategically positioning HPE in the high-performance computing (HPC) sector. This acquisition allows HPE to leverage Cray's exascale system wins and Slingshot interconnect technology, while providing Cray with the financial heft and market reach of a larger company. The deal is expected to solidify HPE's competitive standing against rivals like Dell and IBM in the HPC market.

title: Opinion: AMD and Cray seek to develop fastest supercomputer in the world
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. and Cray Inc. have secured a $600 million contract from the U.S. Department of Energy to develop Frontier, which is expected to be the world's fastest supercomputer. This deal marks an ambitious revival of their partnership, potentially boosting AMD's influence in high-performance computing and data-center chips. Cray previously used AMD CPUs but switched to Intel, only to renew ties after AMD's Epyc data-center processors launched last year.

title: Using HashiCorp Nomad to Schedule GPU Workloads | NVIDIA Technical Blog
summary: HashiCorp Nomad 0.9 introduces device plugins, including one for NVIDIA GPUs, allowing Nomad clients to detect, fingerprint, and make hardware devices available for scheduling workloads. This feature enables users to specify GPU requirements like count, memory, and model type in job specifications, optimizing task placement for GPU-accelerated applications. The article demonstrates how this integration supports deep learning inference applications using NVIDIA's TensorRT Inference Server on a GPU-enabled Nomad cluster.

title: AMD's 50th Anniversary Reminds Us Why The Company Matters
summary: This article reflects on AMD's 50th anniversary, highlighting its resilience, innovation, and historical milestones under various leaders, currently Lisa Su. The author, a long-time observer of AMD, discusses the company's evolution from its founding in 1969 to its current focus on high-performance computing, emphasizing its commitment to execution and a people-centric culture. The piece celebrates AMD's ability to consistently bounce back from challenges and its vision for future technological innovation.

title: AMD Ryzen 7 2700X Gold Edition: Should you buy the new CPU?
summary: The AMD Ryzen 7 2700X Gold Edition is a special release to celebrate AMD's 50th anniversary. It is identical in hardware to the regular Ryzen 7 2700X but includes keepsakes like Dr. Lisa Su's signature on the CPU lid, a commemorative t-shirt, and an autographed sticker. The article suggests that while the price is the same as the regular version, it's primarily for dedicated AMD fans who value the commemorative items, as there's no performance benefit.

title: AMD Commemorates 50th Anniversary with Launch of ‘Gold
summary: AMD is celebrating its 50th anniversary by launching ‘Gold Edition’ versions of its AMD Ryzen 7 2700X processor and AMD Radeon VII graphics card. These special editions include Dr. Lisa Su's signature, gold packaging, and an AMD50 game bundle featuring free copies of Tom Clancy’s The Division 2 Gold Edition and World War Z. Various retailers will also offer special deals on select AMD products during the promotional period from April 29 to June 8, 2019.

title: Bristol-Myers Squibb (BMY) Q1 earnings results
summary: Bristol-Myers Squibb reported better-than-expected first-quarter 2019 results, with revenue up 14% to $5.92 billion and adjusted earnings of $1.10 per share. The biopharma company also announced shareholder approval for its acquisition of Celgene Corporation and raised its 2019 GAAP EPS guidance.

title: Amazon.com Inc. (AMZN) earnings Q1 2019
summary: Amazon.com Inc. surpassed Q1 2019 earnings estimates, with revenues aligning with expectations. Net sales increased 17% year-over-year to $59.7 billion, and net income rose significantly to $3.6 billion. The company provided Q2 2019 sales and operating income guidance and announced expanded YouTube and Prime Video app availability on various devices.

title: Intel roadmaps leak showing company's plans through 2021 - CPU - News
summary: Purported Intel mobile and desktop processor roadmaps have leaked, reportedly from a Dell presentation, detailing plans through Q4 2021. The roadmaps show the introduction of Comet Lake H series processors (14nm) and Ice Lake U (10nm) for mobile, and similar 14nm Comet Lake H and speculative 10nm Rocket Lake processors for desktops, indicating a slower transition to 10nm than previously anticipated by some.

title: GlobalFoundries sells Fab 10 to On Semiconductor
summary: GlobalFoundries has announced the sale of its 300mm wafer facility in East Fishkill, New York, to On Semiconductor for £331 million. This move comes after GlobalFoundries faced challenges with its 7nm production roadmap and spun off other business units, signaling a strategic shift for the company. As part of the deal, GlobalFoundries will continue to use the facility until 2022, after which On Semiconductor will assume full control, with staff also transferring to On Semiconductor.

title: How to Prepare For a Possible Decline in Chip ETFs
summary: This article discusses the semiconductor market, noting its significant year-to-date rally but also highlighting warnings from some analysts about overbought conditions. It suggests that investors could capitalize on a potential downturn using the Direxion Daily Semiconductor Bear 3X ETF (SOXS). The piece also explores diverging opinions on the sector's future, considering factors like 5G technology and upcoming earnings reports.

title: Earnings preview: What to look for when Procter & Gamble reports Q3 results
summary: Procter & Gamble (PG) is set to report its Q3 2019 earnings on April 23, with analysts expecting a 4% EPS increase and a slight revenue bump. The company has consistently beaten earnings estimates, despite facing challenges from changing retail trends, high costs, and currency fluctuations. P&G's diverse product portfolio, brand loyalty, and strategic acquisitions are expected to support its performance and margins.

title: Diodes Incorporated Announces ReDriver IC to Boost Signal Quality Over High-Speed PCIe Interfaces
summary: Diodes Incorporated has announced the PI3EQX16904GL ReDriver IC, designed to maintain signal integrity over high-speed PCIe interfaces for server, storage, and networking applications. This new linear ReDriver is compliant with PCI-SIG’s PCIe 4.0 specification and is backward compatible with older PCIe standards, preventing signal degradation in high-data-rate environments. The device features programmable equalization, output swing, and flat gain to optimize performance across various physical media.

title: Addressing production of SiC super-junction MOSFETs - News
summary: This article discusses a novel ion-implantation technique developed by mi2-factory to improve the manufacturing of SiC power devices, including super-junction MOSFETs. This technology addresses the limitations of conventional SiC doping methods, enabling high-volume production of smaller, more efficient SiC devices by precisely controlling dopant profiles. The technique promises significant cost savings and performance improvements for both super-junction transistors and other SiC power devices like diodes.

title: PepsiCo (PEP) posts upbeat Q1 2019 earnings
summary: PepsiCo announced upbeat first-quarter 2019 earnings, with net revenue increasing by 3% to $12.9 billion and net attributable income rising 6% to $1.4 billion, both exceeding market expectations. The company also provided a positive full-year 2019 outlook, anticipating 4% organic revenue growth and $8 billion in total cash returns to shareholders. CEO Ramon Laguarta highlighted strong performance across several divisions despite adverse foreign exchange rates.

title: zSpace Laptop - Full Review and Benchmarks
summary: The zSpace laptop, priced at $1,299, is reviewed as an innovative educational tool combining AR and VR technologies, despite its shortcomings. While praised for its compelling 3D effects, numerous AR learning apps, and helpful user guides, it is criticized for a dim display, thick and heavy chassis, poor battery life, and underpowered CPU. The article concludes that while it serves its educational purpose well, its various compromises make it a cautious recommendation for educators and business professionals seeking an innovative learning solution.

title: TTM Technologies Inc. makes donation to RIT for research fellowships
summary: TTM Technologies Inc. has donated $177,000 to Rochester Institute of Technology (RIT) to fund doctoral student research fellowships in advanced microwave and antenna technology. This three-year commitment extends a long-standing partnership between TTM and RIT, with the research focusing on areas like metamaterials for wireless, space, and defense applications. Engineers from TTM Technologies will also act as consultants on the projects.

title: Omkaram Nalamasu, Applied Materials
summary: This article profiles Dr. Omkaram Nalamasu, Senior Vice President and Chief Technology Officer of Applied Materials, highlighting his role in developing disruptive products and leading strategic investments. It details his extensive background as a world-renowned expert in materials science, including his prior academic and research leadership positions, and his numerous contributions to the fields of optical lithography and polymeric materials science. The piece also notes his election to the U.S. National Academy of Engineering and his involvement on various boards.

title: Samsung and AMD Announce Strategic Partnership in Ultra Low Power, High Performance Graphics Technologies
summary: Samsung and AMD have announced a multi-year strategic partnership focused on ultra-low power, high-performance mobile graphics IP. Samsung will license AMD's custom Radeon graphics IP, based on the RDNA architecture, for use in its mobile devices, including smartphones. This collaboration aims to accelerate innovation in mobile graphics technologies and expand Radeon graphics into the mobile market.

title: Ushering in a new wave of video surveillance capabilities
summary: Next-generation IP cameras, powered by advanced AI-enabled chips, are revolutionizing video surveillance by processing data at the edge, offering real-time analytics for professional and consumer markets. This on-device processing enhances privacy, reduces network and storage costs, and enables faster reaction times for critical events. The technology is set to impact retail, smart cities, and home monitoring by providing valuable insights and improved security.

title: NVIDIA Is A Data Center Company Now
summary: NVIDIA's acquisition of Mellanox for $6.9 billion signifies its strategic shift from primarily a GPU company to a full-fledged data center company. This move leverages NVIDIA's success in High-Performance Compute (HPC) and AI with GPUs, integrating Mellanox's data center networking expertise to address the growing demands of data science and hyperscale workloads. The article highlights how NVIDIA is expanding its ecosystem to support diverse data center needs, from specialized accelerators to broader infrastructure solutions.

title: Apple rolls out first update to iMac desktop in almost two years
summary: Apple Inc. has introduced the first update to its iMac all-in-one desktop computer since mid-2017, ahead of a major event on March 25. The new iMacs feature speedier Intel processors and AMD graphics engines, with the 4K 21.5-inch models being up to 60 percent faster and the 5K 27-inch versions up to 2.4 times faster. This update follows the recent launch of new iPad Air and iPad mini models, as Apple continues its hardware refreshments.

title: Micron Introduces Client 2200 NVMe SSDs
summary: Micron Technology, Inc. has announced the expansion of its client NVMe SSD lineup with the introduction of the Micron 2200 PCIe NVMe SSD. This new SSD targets OEMs seeking NVMe storage solutions, leveraging 3D TLC NAND and an internally designed ASIC drive controller and firmware in an M.2 form factor. The Micron 2200 offers capacities up to 1TB and boasts read speeds of up to 3GB/s and 240K IOPS, providing improved performance, lower latency, and reduced power consumption compared to traditional spinning disks and SATA SSDs.

title: ARM Goes To War In The Datacenter With “Ares” Designs
summary: ARM is launching its "Ares" Neoverse designs (N1) for datacenters, promising significant performance gains, exceeding their initial 30% annual improvement target. These new designs feature a mesh topology, enhanced power efficiency, and a deep, reconfigurable pipeline, aiming to challenge Intel Xeon and other architectures in the server market. ARM anticipates these cores will scale from edge devices to high-end datacenters, offering competitive power consumption and performance metrics.

title: Machine learning is the biggest disruptive tech: AMD CTO Mark Papermaster
summary: AMD CTO Mark Papermaster discusses the significance of the company's new 7nm chips in meeting the insatiable demand for computational power, especially in data centers and mobile devices. He highlights machine learning as the biggest disruptive technology, noting its potential to leverage data and predict results, while also addressing concerns about AI and robotics replacing human jobs. Papermaster also touches on GPU usage in the crypto space, indicating AMD's focus on broader GPU markets in gaming, servers, and blockchain.

title: Canaan Creative co-founder leaves crypto miner maker: report
summary: Xiangfu Liu, a co-founder of Canaan Creative, has reportedly left the crypto mining hardware manufacturer due to disagreements over the company's overall strategy. Liu, who owns 17.6% of the company, advocated for Canaan to expand into running a crypto mining pool, similar to rival Bitmain, while the management preferred to remain a pure-play manufacturer of chips. This departure comes as Canaan Creative explores an IPO in New York after its previous application in Hong Kong lapsed.

title: Mubadala sells AMD shares for $800 million and converts warrants to retain 6.9% stake
summary: Mubadala, the strategic investment arm of Abu Dhabi, sold 34.9 million shares in Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) for approximately $800 million. Despite the sale, Mubadala will maintain a 6.9% stake in AMD by converting 75 million warrants, which will also provide AMD with $448.5 million. This move aligns with Mubadala's strategy to monetize mature holdings and re-invest in high-growth sectors like technology.

title: Aehr launches FOX-CP wafer-level test & reliability screening system
summary: Aehr Test Systems has launched the FOX-CP, a new low-cost single-wafer test and reliability verification system designed for logic, memory, and photonic devices. This system, part of the FOX-P product family, is optimized for shorter test times, multiple touchdowns, and includes features like 2048 Universal Channels, making it suitable for silicon photonics and VCSEL arrays. The FOX-CP helps reduce test costs by identifying failing die before packaging and is available for order and shipment.

title: Intel's new CEO is facing the same old challenges
summary: Robert "Bob" Swan has been appointed as Intel's CEO at a critical time, inheriting significant challenges in manufacturing, innovation, and navigating a potentially declining PC market and slowing data center growth. Despite strong financial results in 2018, Intel faces intense competition from rivals like Samsung, TSMC, AMD, and ARM licensees, alongside the technical hurdle of pushing past the limits of Moore's Law. Swan, with a finance background, will need to demonstrate his ability to adapt Intel's strategy to these evolving industry dynamics.

title: AI is here to stay. These women want to make sure Intel does it right.
summary: This article highlights four women at Intel, including Anna Bethke, Huma Abidi, Yinyin Liu, and Jennifer Myers, who are working to shape Intel's growing AI business. Their goal is to find real-world applications for artificial intelligence as Intel aims to increase its AI business revenue from $1 billion to $10 billion by 2022. The piece underscores the significance of their roles in the future of AI within the company.

title: AMD Radeon VII lags behind the RTX 2080 in latest 3DMark leak
summary: A leaked 3DMark Time Spy benchmark suggests the upcoming AMD Radeon VII GPU, set to launch on February 7, will lag behind Nvidia's RTX 2080. While it significantly outperforms the RX Vega 64 and RTX 2070, the Radeon VII's graphics and combined scores fall short of the RTX 2080 based on these early results. AMD had previously promised RTX 2080-level performance for its new 7nm gaming GPU.

title: Intel names permanent CEO, said to benefit firm’s Israel operations
summary: Intel has named Robert Swan as its permanent CEO. This appointment is expected to benefit the firm's operations in Israel due to Swan's familiarity with its activities there. Intel has significant investments and operations in Israel, including manufacturing and R&D centers, and recently announced an $11 billion investment for a new plant in Kiryat Gat.

title: Intel names Robert Swan as permanent CEO
summary: Intel has named Robert Swan as its permanent CEO, ending a seven-month search following the ouster of Brian Krzanich. Swan, who was previously interim CEO and CFO, initially expressed disinterest in the role but accepted after internal developments. His appointment signals Intel's continued focus on diversifying its portfolio beyond PC-centric revenue towards data-centric opportunities.

title: Opinion: AMD has won Wall Street’s trust, and its stock is showing the results
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) and CEO Lisa Su have successfully built credibility with Wall Street, reflected in the company's stock performance. Despite a recent revenue miss and a rival's warning, the company's ability to meet its commitments has fostered belief in its future forecasts, which are heavily weighted towards the second half of the year. This marks a significant turnaround for AMD, a company that previously struggled with Wall Street's trust.

title: Why Advanced Micro Devices might be important for service providers
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is becoming increasingly important for service providers due to its high-performance server processors like Epyc, which are crucial for hyperscale cloud players and data center updates. The company reported strong financial results in 2018, with significant growth in its data center business, and expects further adoption with its upcoming "Rome" processor, which offers improved performance and socket compatibility. As operators like AT&T, Sprint, and Comcast transform their networks with generic hardware, AMD's server technology is poised to play a key role in their data center evolution.

title: Harley-Davidson hits rough road, and now all eyes move to Apple
summary: Harley-Davidson Inc. is facing significant demand issues, evident from a substantial bottom-line miss, lower-than-expected revenue, and a bleak outlook for motorcycle sales in 2019. The company projects a slow start to the year and does not anticipate immediate improvement in its U.S. market position. This weak performance shifts market attention to upcoming earnings reports, particularly from Apple, in its shadow.

title: Intel misses on revenue and gives weak guidance — stock falls after hours
summary: Intel's stock fell sharply after the company reported lower-than-expected revenue for fiscal fourth-quarter 2018 and issued weak guidance for 2019. The company missed analyst estimates on Q4 revenue and Q1 2019 earnings and revenue forecasts. Investors are also keenly awaiting an update on Intel's search for a permanent CEO, seven months after Brian Krzanich's departure.

title: Intel (INTC) Q4 2018 earnings report
summary: Intel reported mixed results for its fourth quarter of 2018, with earnings per share beating analyst estimates but revenue falling short. The stock dropped in after-hours trading, and the company issued a cautious outlook for 2019, citing intensifying trade concerns and other market dynamics. Despite the revenue miss, Intel's CFO highlighted record-breaking projections for the coming year driven by data growth.

title: NVIDIA Resets The Self-Driving Bar Again With AutoPilot Supporting 'Level 2+'
summary: NVIDIA announced its DRIVE AutoPilot system at CES 2019, which it describes as the "world's first commercially available Level 2+ automated driving system" that will enable supervised self-driving vehicles by 2020. The company also revealed that Mercedes-Benz has chosen NVIDIA as its AI partner for developing next-generation vehicles. Additionally, NVIDIA launched the new GeForce RTX 2060 GPU and announced over 40 new gaming laptops featuring GeForce RTX GPUs.

title: Ambarella's CV25 camera SoC with CVflow computer vision processing | Security News
summary: Ambarella has unveiled the CV25 camera System-on-Chip (SoC), part of its CVflow family, designed for next-generation intelligent solutions. This SoC integrates advanced image processing, high-resolution video encoding, and CVflow computer vision processing into a low-power design. The CV25 enables AI at the edge for applications like home monitoring, surveillance, and automotive solutions, supporting features such as facial recognition and driver monitoring.

title: Opinion: AMD’s Lisa Su takes center stage at CES, taking aim at Intel and Nvidia
summary: During her CES keynote, AMD CEO Lisa Su declared the company's intention to challenge and potentially surpass rivals Intel and Nvidia. She outlined AMD's 2019 strategies for computers, servers, and videogames, showcasing early performance of its 7-nanometer hardware. Su emphasized that the company's significant investments are now yielding results and are expected to continue doing so throughout 2019.

title: Motherboard supports up to 300-watt Intel Core X-series processors
summary: Super Micro Computer, Inc. showcased its latest desktop, gaming, and workstation solutions at CES 2019. This includes the SuperO C9Z390-PGW, known for high overclocking performance, and the C9X299-PG300, which supports up to 300-watt Intel Core X-series processors. The company also presented the X11SPA-T workstation platform and several other motherboards for mainstream gamers.

title: The best and worst stocks of 2018
summary: This article reviews the best and worst performing stocks of 2018 for the Dow industrials and S&P 500, respectively. Merck led the Dow gainers, while AMD topped the S&P 500. A key theme for the stock market in 2018 was the return of volatility, influenced by investor concerns over Federal Reserve tightening and President Trump’s trade dispute with China.

title: Opinion: AMD’s Lisa Su takes center stage at CES, taking aim at Intel and Nvidia
We Tried the First Augmented Reality Laptop, and It’s Awesome
summary: The zSpace Laptop PC is introduced as the first Windows laptop to combine augmented and virtual reality, targeting the education and enterprise markets with an estimated affordable price of $1,500. The article details a hands-on experience with the device, highlighting its intuitive interface, specialized 3D display, head-tracking sensors, 3D glasses, and stylus for interactive 3D experiences. It also covers the laptop's specifications, including an AMD APU A9-9420 CPU, 8GB RAM, and a 256GB SSD, and notes its functionality as a standard Windows 10 PC when not using 3D effects.

title: ZSpace’s laptop brings education to life with its own 3D technology
summary: The ZSpace laptop is designed for students, educators, and healthcare providers, offering an all-in-one solution for mixed reality content. It combines specialized 3D screen technology, lightweight glasses, and bespoke software to make augmented and virtual reality more accessible. The laptop features a dual-core AMD APU A9-9420, 8GB DDR4 memory, and a 256GB SSD, running Windows 10 with a 15.6-inch 1080p display capable of 3D viewing.

title: New AMD Radeon Vega logo sparks speculation about potential APU refresh
summary: A newly discovered AMD-related image trademark, featuring a modified Vega logo, has sparked speculation about a potential APU refresh or a new Radeon Vega II series. The modified "V" logo with two vertical lines is being interpreted by some as a hint towards a Vega II architecture, possibly for an APU refresh like the Raven Ridge line-up, or even in reference to a 7 nm manufacturing process. AMD's official roadmap doesn't mention Vega II, leading to varied theories about the trademark's meaning, including a connection to the new Instinct line-up or future use.

title: China block of iPhone sales, memory outlook don’t hurt chip stocks
summary: Chip-related stocks saw a rebound despite news of China blocking sales of older iPhone models due to Qualcomm patent violations and ongoing tariff concerns. The PHLX Semiconductor Index outperformed broader market indexes, suggesting that investors are not significantly swayed by these developments regarding the chip sector's outlook. This performance indicates a recovery for chip stocks which had previously experienced selloffs throughout the year.

title: ARM, AMD, AWS and Annapurna Labs
summary: This article discusses the history behind Amazon's Graviton processor, revealing that its development was nearly a collaboration with AMD. It explains how AMD's focus on Zen architecture led Amazon to acquire Annapurna Labs to design the chip in-house. The piece also touches on AMD's past ARM chip efforts and the broader implications for the server chip market.

title: AMD's Mark Papermaster turned company's failure into success, when it needed it most
summary: The article highlights how Mark Papermaster, CTO of AMD, played a crucial role in the company's turnaround from a struggling state to a fast-growing success. He is recognized as a 2018 C-Suite honoree for his leadership in reinventing the company when its existence was threatened. Papermaster's efforts are credited with steering AMD through a critical period.

title: Nvidia tumbles 19% after missing on revenue and guidance
summary: Nvidia's stock dropped 18.8 percent after the company missed analyst expectations for third-quarter 2019 revenue and provided lower-than-anticipated guidance for the next quarter. The company cited surplus inventory, particularly in its midrange Pascal gaming segment, as a major factor. This news also caused a 3.9 percent drop in shares for competitor Advanced Micro Devices.

title: Nvidia Corp. (NVDA) earnings Q3 2019
summary: Nvidia Corp. (NVDA) reported a surge in Q3 2019 earnings per share, beating estimates, despite revenue falling short of expectations and weak Q4 guidance. The company's stock dropped 16% in after-hours trading due to the revenue miss and outlook. Nvidia saw strong growth in its Datacenter business and other segments, while also announcing increased dividends and share repurchase plans.

title: Earnings: Plug Power shrinks Q3 loss as revenue beats estimates
summary: Hydrogen fuel cell maker Plug Power Inc reported a significant decrease in its Q3 loss and beat revenue estimates, with net revenue soaring 54% to $53.2 million. The company's net loss shrunk to $0.07 per share, demonstrating improved financial performance. Plug Power also highlighted robust sales of GenDrive fuel cell units and GenFuel hydrogen stations, leading to lifted gross revenue targets for fiscal 2018.

title: Advanced Micro Devices stock jumps after getting chip order from Amazon
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock rose after Amazon.com Inc.'s cloud unit announced it would use AMD's Epyc data center chips for its services. This move is expected to boost AMD's revenue growth within its Enterprise, Embedded and Semi-Custom business. AMD shares climbed 2.13% in premarket trading, following a 3.92% increase the previous day, while Amazon shares also saw a premarket rise.

title: When Robots Ring the Bell (Published 2018)
summary: Robo Global celebrated the fifth anniversary of its robotics index and exchange-traded fund at the New York Stock Exchange by having a robot ring the closing bell. This event symbolized the growing integration of robotics and artificial intelligence into various sectors of the economy. Experts describe this shift as the fourth industrial revolution, highlighting the massive growth potential and increasing prevalence of automation to boost productivity.

title: Why style differentiation matters in US equity investing
summary: This article discusses the importance of style differentiation in US equity investing, particularly highlighting the outperformance of large-cap growth funds over the last five years. It examines how technology stocks have driven this growth, recent reclassifications of S&P 500 sectors, and the debate among investors regarding the sustainability of this trend versus the potential for value-based strategies to rebound, emphasizing the merits of combining growth and value styles.

title: We're Likely to See AI Merge With Blockchain in the Future
summary: This article discusses the potential merger of artificial intelligence (AI) and blockchain technologies, highlighting early examples like SingularityNET, a marketplace where AI developers can earn cryptocurrency for their work. It also explores how AI might impact cryptocurrency mining and how blockchain could facilitate power-hungry AI applications in scientific and medical research. The piece suggests that the combination of these technologies could lead to faster development, increased efficiency, and more decentralized control in various sectors.

title: ARK Next Generation Internet ETF
summary: The ARK Next Generation Internet ETF (ARKW) is an actively-managed fund that invests in companies benefiting from advancements in cloud computing, e-commerce, AI, and other disruptive technologies. Led by Catherine Wood, the fund aims to outperform the market and has a track record of doing so despite its higher expense ratio compared to passive ETFs. It targets investors who believe in the long-term growth of internet-related industries and are comfortable with active management.

title: How to invest in UAE stock markets
summary: This article provides guidance on how retail investors can invest in UAE stock markets, including advice on finding brokers, available products like ETFs and REITs, and considerations for investing in local stocks. Issam Kassabieh, a senior financial analyst at Menacorp, offers insights into defensive sectors, high-growth stocks, and risk management specific to the UAE market.

title: Why AMD's Stock May Plunge 12% Further
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) stock is projected to fall an additional 12% from its current price, based on technical analysis, following a 20% drop from its 2018 intraday highs. The technical breakdown indicates that if the stock falls below a support level of $25.75, it could decline further to $24. Despite expectations for strong third-quarter earnings, high volatility and a larger volume of bearish put options suggest ongoing price pressure.

title: Costco Wholesale Corp. Q4 2018 earnings
summary: Costco (COST) reported higher-than-expected Q4 sales and earnings, with revenues up 5% to $44.41 billion and net profit reaching $1.04 billion. Despite strong financial performance and membership revenue growth, the stock fell in after-market trading due to the company's disclosure of a "material weakness" in its internal control over financial reporting. E-commerce sales growth, while significant at 26.2%, fell short of expectations amid increased competition.

title: Opinion: Why AMD believes it can challenge Intel in servers
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) is challenging Intel Corp.'s dominance in the server market with new chips, leveraging what it believes is superior technology. While AMD has had similar challenges in the past followed by setbacks, its recent rise suggests a potential turnaround might be more sustainable this time, reminiscent of its technological breakthrough in the early 2000s. The company sees significant opportunity for gains in data centers, a crucial sector in today's technology landscape.

title: 3D Universe Introduces Skin Tone Filaments for 3D Printed Prosthetics
summary: 3D Universe has introduced four new skin tone PETG filament colors for 3D printed prosthetics, addressing the demand for more subtle, flesh-toned devices. This initiative, developed with feedback from the e-NABLE community, helps individuals, particularly in cultures valuing blending in, feel more comfortable with their prosthetics. The PETG filaments are chosen for their ease of printing, strength, and temperature resistance, with a portion of sales supporting the e-NABLE community.

title: AMD Stock Price Has Paused, Investors Should Pause As Well
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) experienced a significant stock surge but has since paused in the mid-$30s. While AMD's long-term outlook remains promising due to its technological advancements and competitive gains against Intel and Nvidia, its current valuation is considered high, suggesting investors should proceed with caution in the short term. The article advises waiting for a modest pullback or for financials to catch up before investing, highlighting strong long-term fundamentals despite the current overvaluation.

title: This chart shows AMD stock at historically overbought levels
summary: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) shares have reached historically overbought levels, with its stock more than doubling its 200-day moving average and its Relative Strength Index (RSI) remaining above the overbought threshold. The stock soared 7.1% on a Friday, putting it on track for a 12-year high, and has more than tripled year-to-date (up 218%) driven by strong earnings and optimism for new chipsets. This contrasts with chief rival Intel Corp. whose shares have lost ground.

title: AMD stock 5-month, 200% rally resumes after third analyst posts $40 price target
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock resumed its rally after a brief pullback, with another analyst setting a $40 price target. The stock is experiencing its best year since 1975, reaching 12-year highs. Despite a Thursday dip, shares rose on Friday morning.

title: Glow: A community-driven approach to AI infrastructure
summary: Meta (Facebook) is expanding its hardware ecosystem for machine learning by announcing support for the Glow compiler from partners like Cadence, Esperanto, Intel, Marvell, and Qualcomm Technologies Inc. Glow, an open-source framework, enables rapid design and optimization of new silicon products for AI/ML by leveraging community-driven compiler software. This initiative aims to accelerate inference performance across various hardware platforms and extend hardware acceleration beyond data centers to mobile devices and other industries.

title: How this CEO avoided the glass cliff and turned around an "uninvestable" company
summary: Lisa Su, CEO of AMD, successfully turned around the struggling tech company after it faced significant losses and was deemed "uninvestable." Her strategy focused on three clear objectives: building great products, deepening customer relationships, and simplifying operations, while also fostering an open and learning-oriented company culture. Su's pragmatic leadership and communication style helped AMD achieve 25% revenue growth in 2017 and return to profitability.

title: AMD Stock is Up 190% in 2018. Be Careful Now
summary: This article analyzes AMD's stock performance in 2018, noting its 190% year-to-date increase, significantly outperforming the S&P 500. While Elliott Wave analysis initially predicted a rise based on the cryptocurrency mining boom, the author cautions that the semiconductor industry's cyclical nature means AMD's current rally is approaching historical resistance levels, suggesting increased risk despite recent gains.

title: Micron, KLA-Tencor warnings send chip-related stocks to worst day in more than two months
summary: Chip-related stocks experienced their worst day in over two months after Micron and KLA-Tencor issued warnings, suggesting a softer-than-expected rebound. The PHLX Semiconductor Index dropped 2.7%, significantly underperforming the S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite. This indicates concerns about the outlook for semiconductor equipment companies.

title: Micron, KLA-Tencor warnings send chip-related stocks to worst day in more than two months
summary: Chip-related stocks experienced their worst day in over two months after Micron and KLA-Tencor issued market outlooks weaker than previously forecasted. The PHLX Semiconductor Index dropped 2.7% on Thursday, marking its largest one-day percentage decline since June 25. This downturn suggests that a rebound in the chip industry may be softer than anticipated, impacting chip-equipment companies the hardest.

title: TSMC Benefits From Globalfoundries’ Decision to End 7nm Development
summary: Globalfoundries' decision to halt 7nm process development has significantly reordered the semiconductor manufacturing landscape, benefiting TSMC as AMD shifts its next-generation CPU and GPU production to the Taiwanese foundry. While Globalfoundries focuses on its 14nm and 12nm processes, analysts suggest that abandoning advanced node development could negatively impact Globalfoundries' long-term viability. This strategic move highlights the increasing challenges and costs associated with pushing Moore's Law, strengthening TSMC's position in the industry.

title: AMD Debuts High-Performance VDI Solution for Datacenter Workloads
summary: AMD introduced its Radeon Pro V340 graphics card at VMworld 2018, a dual-GPU VDI solution designed for demanding datacenter visualization workloads like CAD, DaaS, and rendering. Based on AMD's "Vega" architecture, it boasts 32GB of high-bandwidth memory and features like superior user density, an integrated encode engine, and a built-in security processor. The card is expected to be available from leading system vendors in Q4 2018.

title: AMD short sellers gutted by ‘stealthy short squeeze’
summary: Short sellers of Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (AMD) have experienced significant losses, nearing $3 billion on paper, due to a "stealthy short squeeze" throughout 2018. AMD's stock performance has been exceptional, leading the S&P 500 with its highest closing price since 2006. The stock surged 5.3% on Monday, closing at $25.26, and continued its upward trend for a seventh consecutive session.

title: Lattice Semiconductor On Boards Jim Anderson as CEO
summary: Lattice Semiconductor announced the appointment of Jim Anderson as its new President and Chief Executive Officer, effective September 4, 2018. Anderson, previously with Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), is recognized for his leadership in transforming businesses and driving sustained growth and profitability. He brings over 20 years of technology industry experience and a strong track record of creating shareholder value.

title: GlobalFoundries Halts 7nm Work
summary: GlobalFoundries has halted its 7nm process technology development, citing the high financial investment required and limited market demand compared to older nodes. This decision forces its primary customer, AMD, to rely entirely on TSMC for initial 7nm chips, potentially impacting AMD's supply and market share gains. GlobalFoundries will now focus on enhancing its 14/12nm node and FD-SOI technology, aiming for improved financial performance and positive cash flow.

title: NVIDIA Reinvents Computer Graphics with Turing Architecture
summary: NVIDIA announced its new Turing GPU architecture, marking a significant advancement in computer graphics with the introduction of real-time ray tracing through new RT Cores and AI inferencing via Tensor Cores. This hybrid rendering approach aims to revolutionize the visual effects industry and bring cinematic-quality interactive experiences to designers and artists. The company also unveiled its initial Turing-based products, the NVIDIA® Quadro® RTX™ 8000, 6000, and 5000 GPUs.

title: Preparing for explosive growth, AMD execs tout need for more women in chip industry
summary: AMD executives are emphasizing the critical need to recruit diverse talent, particularly women, as the company prepares for significant growth that could surpass competitors like Intel. This call for diversity comes amidst AMD's rapid expansion in the chip industry. The article highlights the importance of increasing female representation to support the company's future development.

title: 3 Big Stock Charts for Friday: Nektar Therapeutics, Waters and A.O. Smith
summary: This article analyzes three stock charts for Nektar Therapeutics (NKTR), Waters (WAT), and A.O. Smith (AOS), offering insights into their potential movements. It suggests Nektar Therapeutics is poised for an uptrend, Waters shows bearish signs, and A.O. Smith is in a developed downtrend. The analysis is based on technical indicators like engulfing bars, moving averages, head-and-shoulders patterns, and volume clues.

title: TSMC Chip Maker Blames WannaCry Malware for Production Halt
summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company (TSMC) experienced a production halt across several chip-fabrication factories due to a variant of the WannaCry malware. The cyberattack, which was not a direct hack but rather an infection spread through tainted software installed by a supplier, is expected to impact revenue by approximately $256 million and cause shipment delays. Although full operations have resumed, the incident raises concerns, especially for key customers like Apple, for whom TSMC is a sole supplier of SoC components.

title: Intel Corporation (INTC) Is Losing Its Market Share
summary: Intel Corporation is losing market share in PC and server microprocessors to competitors like Advanced Micro Devices. Barclays downgraded INTC stock due to Intel's lagging technology and uncertain CEO transition, while Bank of America noted AMD's significant share gains in Q2 2018. Despite healthy demand for semiconductors, analysts suggest AMD is currently a better investment than Intel.

title: Electronics Quality Assurance Company CIMS Opens an Outpost in Israel
summary: Chinese electronic quality assurance company CIMS has opened a new R&D center in Israel, focusing on image processing and AI technologies for electronics manufacturing. The center, inaugurated in mid-July, currently employs 30 people and plans to expand to 50 within three years. CIMS, a spin-off of Israeli company Camtek, became independent in 2017 after its PCB business was acquired by Principle Capital, which is now looking to further invest and acquire companies in Israel.

title: Tech Pullback Signals Buying Opportunity
summary: Despite a broader tech sector pullback, ETF investors are showing confidence in semiconductor stocks, funneling significant money into semiconductor ETFs. This trend is driven by strong earnings from chipmakers and continued demand fueled by companies like Apple, suggesting a potential buying opportunity in the sector even as other tech giants face headwinds. The divergent performance indicates a belief in the resilience of semiconductor companies amidst overall market volatility.

title: AMD Stock Breaks Out but Approaches Overbought Levels
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock rose 2.5% after Cowen & Co. reiterated an Outperform rating and raised its price target, citing opportunities in data centers and client markets, especially with upcoming 7nm products. This upgrade follows Intel's 10nm chip delay, which could allow AMD to gain market share. Despite breaking out to new highs, technical indicators suggest the stock is approaching overbought levels, potentially leading to consolidation before further gains.

title: Intel Corporation (INTC) Earnings Beat Overshadowed by Product Delays
summary: Intel Corporation reported stronger-than-expected second-quarter earnings and revenue but its stock dropped over 8% after announcing further delays for its 10-nanometer processors. Analysts believe these delays could lead to market share loss to competitors like Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) and have prompted a downgrade of Intel's stock. The company's CEO, Bob Swan, indicated that the 10nm products are now expected by the holiday season in 2019, instead of an earlier 2019 launch.

title: Semicon Emerging Memory
summary: This article discusses insights from the 2018 Semicon Conference on emerging memory technologies such as MRAM, ReRAM, PCM, and FeRAM, which are poised to challenge incumbent memory types like NAND flash and DRAM. Industry experts from companies like Everspin, Global Foundries, Spin Transfer Technologies, and Crossbar presented advancements and potential applications for these new memories, highlighting their scaling capabilities, power efficiency, and integration into CMOS processes. The article also mentions imec's research across various emerging memory technologies and sustainable practices.

title: ETF investor says own chip stocks to ride the next technology boom
summary: Sean O’Hara, president of Pacer ETFs Distributors, argues that chipmaking companies, rather than traditional tech giants, are the future of the technology sector, driven by the expansion of the "internet of things" and advancements in AI and blockchain. Pacer ETFs Distributors is overweight on information technology, specifically semiconductors, which O'Hara considers the "spine or skeleton of technology." He highlights Micron Technology due to its cash flow generation and low trading multiples, noting its plan to buy back $10 billion in stock.

title: High-Volume Manufacturing Device Overlay Process Control
authors: John C. Robinson b a SK Hynix
summary: This article discusses the challenges and solutions for non-zero overlay (NZO) process control in high-volume semiconductor manufacturing, particularly at advanced technology nodes. It details a hybrid control scheme using high-frequency optical metrology at DI and infrequent SEM-based metrology at FI, implemented within KLA-Tencor Corporation’s 5D Analyzer, to characterize and control NZO variability. The study analyzes BLC and SCC layer data, identifying static NZO signatures and the potential of DI optical metrics like Qmerit to identify change points and minimize costly SEM FI metrology.

title: Field Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGA) Market Globally by 2025 |
summary: A new research report details the global Field Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGA) market, projecting healthy growth from 2018 to 2025. The report highlights the increasing demand for programmable solutions due to the high costs and complexities associated with traditional Application Specific Integrated Circuits (ASICs). Key players in the FPGA market, product types, and geographical analysis are also covered, aiming to provide insights into market trends and future strategies.

title: Why AMD's Overbought Shares Will Fall Further
summary: Shares of Advanced Micro Devices Inc. have seen significant gains but are now considered overbought according to technical analysis, suggesting a potential decline. Despite a strong growth outlook and analyst expectations for earnings and revenue increases, the stock's valuation is high compared to peers, and many analysts do not rate it as a strong buy, indicating it may be fully priced. The article warns of further downside potential due to technical resistance and an extremely high relative strength index.

title: New Arista switches use Barefoot Tofino programmable chip
summary: Arista has launched its 7170 series of switches, which are equipped with the Barefoot Networks Tofino programmable packet processor. These new switches are designed to consolidate functions typically handled by network appliances and routers, aiming to reduce costs and network complexity for large enterprises, cloud, and communication service providers. The programmability is enabled by P4, an open-source language, and Arista provides application profiles for various network functions.

title: History Says to Buy June Calls on Advanced Micro Devices Stock
summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) stock is showing a short-term bullish signal, making June calls attractive despite its historical volatility in summer months. The stock's Schaeffer's Volatility Index is low, and past similar signals have led to significant gains. However, July has historically been a challenging month for AMD.

title: Cisco puts AMD silicon into a new system for compute-intensive applications
summary: Cisco Systems Inc. has unveiled the UCS C4200, a new server system featuring AMD's Epyc processors, targeting compute-intensive applications. This move by Cisco further validates AMD's efforts to gain market share in the data center, having previously partnered with Microsoft and Baidu. Despite increased shipments, AMD still faces a challenge in significantly denting Intel's dominant position.

title: Supermicro Unveils 2 PetaFLOPS SuperServer Based on New NVIDIA HGX-2, the World’s Most Powerful Cloud Server Platform for AI and HPC
summary: Supermicro announced its adoption of the NVIDIA HGX-2 cloud server platform to develop the world's most powerful systems for AI and HPC, capable of delivering over double the performance. The new HGX-2 system features 16 Tesla V100 32GB SXM3 GPUs connected via NVLink and NVSwitch, functioning as a unified 2 PetaFlop accelerator with half a terabyte of aggregate memory. This innovation is crucial for training increasingly large and complex AI models and handling demanding HPC applications, helping to save significant cost, space, and energy in data centers.

title: Nvidia Q1 2019 earnings
summary: Nvidia reported record first-quarter 2019 results, with net income more than doubling to $1.24 billion and revenues surging 66% to $3.21 billion, driven by strong growth in gaming and datacenter segments. Despite crushing estimates, the company's shares dipped over 2% after the announcement. Nvidia plans to return $1.25 billion to stockholders in fiscal 2019 and projects Q2 revenues of around $3.10 billion.

title: Jim Keller Joins Intel to Lead Silicon Engineering
summary: Intel announced that Jim Keller will join the company as a senior vice president to lead silicon engineering, including system-on-chip (SoC) development and integration. Keller brings over two decades of experience in x86 and ARM-based microarchitecture design from companies like Tesla, AMD, and Apple, where he contributed to the Zen architecture and early A-series processors. His appointment is expected to accelerate Intel's transformation in heterogeneous process and architectures for the data-centric computing era.

title: Why Domino's Pizza, Advanced Micro Devices, and Alexion Pharmaceuticals Jumped Today
summary: Domino's Pizza, Advanced Micro Devices, and Alexion Pharmaceuticals all saw significant stock gains following positive financial results. Domino's reported strong revenue and comparable-restaurant sales, AMD benefited from high demand for its CPUs and GPUs, and Alexion received good news from a phase 3 study for one of its pipeline drugs. These strong performances contributed to a positive day on Wall Street, especially for the Nasdaq Composite.

title: Opinion: Intel, beware: AMD is a different company than it was just two years ago
summary: The article highlights Advanced Micro Devices' resurgence, noting that the company, under CEO Lisa Su, is now a significant competitor to Intel. AMD is releasing a robust pipeline of new chips, including the Ryzen 2000-series PC processors, targeting critical consumer markets. This marks a period of consistent execution for AMD not seen in over a decade.

title: HP's Executive Forum Gives Insights Into Business, Products, And Just As Important, Company Culture
summary: This article discusses key insights from HP's Executive Forum, highlighting new product announcements in gaming, personal systems, and printing, along with updates on their 3D printing initiatives. Beyond product reveals, the author emphasizes the strong company culture, particularly noting the heartfelt tribute to the late COO Jon Flaxman, which revealed the close-knit relationships within HP's leadership. The forum served to showcase HP’s strategic roadmap and its focus on both innovation and internal values.

title: Cadence CEO: “EDA’s a Systems Game”
summary: Cadence CEO Lip-Bu Tan discusses how EDA is becoming a "systems game" as more system companies are designing their own chips. He highlights the growth in AI accelerator investments, the importance of silicon photonics and high-speed SerDes, and China's strategic ambitions in semiconductor design and AI. Tan also touches on the continued strong design activity at advanced process nodes despite rising costs and complexity.

title: AMD is Proud to Present a Multi-Year Partnership with Scuderia Ferrari
